results.description:
Hello fellow wine lovers. The purpose of this group is to explore various categories of wine in a relaxed setting while dining out in Westchester BYOB restaurants. For each dinner meetup, a theme will be chosen and the wines will be provided by the host, who will disclose the identities of the wines (along with ratings, reviews, and prices) when the meetup is announced. The wines will be carefully chosen as good examples of their type and offer a good price-quality ratio. To facilitate dinner-table discussions and to ensure that everyone is able to taste and retaste all the wines, attendance will be capped at 10 people per dinner. To cover the cost of the wines, attendees will pay a fee when RSVPing. Then at the restaurant, each attendee will pay for whatever food he/she orders.

The organizer has earned the Diploma of Wines and Spirits from the Wine and Spirit Education Trust, and looks forward to sharing some interesting bottles over good food and conversation.

results.description:
Updated:  June 20, 2015 


Welcome women trail runners and fast hikers!


Let's get together to trail run/walk/fast hike for safety, fun, and fitness in a group to explore the beautiful, local natural settings. Many of these local mini-adventures will be exploratory -- so bring a map if you are unfamiliar with the local woods.

Note: The organizer is based in CA, but was born in NJ and visits family often. Local members are welcome to suggest meets on their favorite trail routes!


News

Membership fees (dues) 
$1 /year 

Free month trial membership. Then, $1 cash join fee after active trial membership, plus $1 cash/year due the 31st of January, to renew every year.


Schedule in 2015

Morning group trail run-walks usually take place on:

6/7 AM (pre-workday) on Tuesdays and Thursdays, 9/10AM Saturdays, and 10 AM on Sundays (easy) in Essex, County, primarily in the Eagle Rock reservation and South Mountain reservation areas. 

Runners of all paces, including back of the pack runners, and those returning to running from injury, are welcome. Our group is small and limited in size to keep our meets from becoming impersonal, and to maintain an active, consistent roster of members. If the meet attendance is large enough, we can divide into pace groups.

We invite new women members of all paces to drop-in and attend meets for a free month trial. Join us for weekly morning runs, on hilly, rocky dirt trails.


________________________________________________________________________

ABOUT US

Women's trail running group (WTRG)
Essex County, NJ


"Generations and community running together in nature"

Discover and learn local trails using maps, with a group! Trail runs typically take place in Essex county: Eagle Rock reservation and South Mountain reservations. We run in darkness, rain, and/or sun.

Regular runs include: weekday morning training runs (5+ miles of trail fartlek, tempo, hill repeats), easy Sundays (~3-7 mi.), and weekend long runs with pace groups as needed. 

This is a private group of local, active members of various speeds, ages, and abilities. Our active members are family, friends, and neighbors. Members know their own limits and respect them, and practice Leave No Trace. Members participate in-person and train consistently for trail events, 5Ks to ultras (e.g., trail races by The North Face Endurance Challenge, etc.). We also occasionally list cross-training meets (e.g., yoga) that support performance and overall well-being.

This is not a coached group. This group's events, organized by unpaid volunteers, are for people who love nature, running on our local trails, and community.



Requirements

• Safety first! Bring water, fuel, headlamp, map, and other items if required for a meet, for the safety and enjoyment of the group. 

• Ability to run or run-walk at least six miles.

• Submit a clear headshot photo, with an unobstructed view of your face. 

• Trial period: Trial members must attend meets (at least one non-race) during the free trial period if they wish to continue. Site access ends after trial period. 

• To retain membership, attend WTRG group trail runs (non-races) on a monthly basis and pay dues. Memberships, of those who are inactive for over a month or with unpaid dues, will be deleted without notice. 

• Specific fitness or trail race/event goals. 

• Runners of all paces are welcome; however, you must be able to run the distance specified for the meet for which you are signed up. 

• Ability to navigate using a trail map. Courses will not be marked. 

• Self-sufficiency as well as the ability to work well with others. 

• Positive attitude. 

• Carry your own water and fuel. Follow the American Trail Running Association (ATRA) trail etiquette guidelines (including registering/paying for races you plan to run, or volunteering with a race organization to earn free race credit. No "bandits.") 

• Wear appropriate trail running attire and shoes. 

• You must be age 21 or older. 

• You and your guests assume all risk associated with participating in these activities. 

• Joining solely with the objective of promoting a business or lurking is prohibited. Please join to run with us!


Membership fees (dues)
Contribute $1 after joining, plus $1/year due the 31st of January, of every year. Please contribute the $1 cash joining fee to the organizers at a meet. It is due within a month of joining. Each member is responsible for paying his fees on time. Reminders will not be sent. Fees and participation in runs are required to retain and renew membership. These nominal fees help cover the payment for the group's Meetup site (link). Membership fees are non-refundable.


Profile photo 
Submit a clear headshot of yourself, for your profile page prior to joining. For the safety of the group, we must be able to see what you look like. We use these photos to find and identify each other when meeting at trail run sites (especially for meeting new people -- strangers). See organizer photo as an example.


RSVP and removal policy  
RSVP if you plan to attend. Guests (incl. men) of family, friends, partners, and strollers (on suitable terrain) are most welcome with an RSVP. If you need to cancel, please change your RSVP online. Like other groups, we have a "three strikes" policy.

Organizers have the right to immediately remove any member from the group without notice for any reason including, but not limited to, the following. The member has three no-shows, does not pay membership fees on time, is inactive for over a month, does not meet requirements,and/or violates Meetup's Terms of Service.

Volunteers take valuable time to prepare and organize these events. This includes: the time and energy spent choosing routes, finding maps, talking to park and race officials, answering questions, emails and calls, etc. Please thank the volunteers. (Healthy post-long run food contributions are always welcome!)


Race and fitness goals

"Join forces. While many runners embrace the solitude of running, numerous studies highlight the benefits of working out with others, including greater satisfaction with exercise, increased motivation to set and reach goals, and greater consistency."
-- The Bliss List, Runner's World

"A race can give you something to focus on, an opportunity to be part of the running community, and a way to celebrate your training." -- Training Tips: Trail Running, Five Tips From Champion Ultrarunner Michael Wardian


Volunteering 
Volunteering is a great way to support and help sustain the running community and environment. Members of our group have volunteered for local community events, such as those by: The North Face Endurance Challenge, Girls on the Run and races.

Our motto: "Run, have fun, respect others, and respect nature!"
(Eat, repeat... :)*


Interested? Click on "join." Happy Trails!




___________________

Notes

Info on Women and Running. 

* Though it's mainly a run for women, ladies have asked if male relatives, partners, friends, children, and/or supporters can come. That's fine -- they can come to support you!

* This is not a club or organized training program. It is just a notice of runs some members are planning to do that is sent out to those who might want to join them. By choosing to join them, you agree that you are an adult and are solely responsible for your own decisions and actions, and you voluntarily assume any and all risks associated with participating, including but not limited to, following course directions, falls, contact with other runners, injuries from wildlife or any other injuries, the effects of the weather, the conditions of the roads and trails, traffic on the course, etc. By choosing to join them, you, for yourself and anyone entitled to and on your behalf, waive and release the Women's Trail run-walk group, its organizers, members, and their heirs from all claims or liabilities of any kind arising out of your participation in these events. Thanks.


Photo: South Mountain Reservation by Rosanna

Copyright 2014-15 Women's Trail run-walk group




This group's event details are available only to members for privacy and safety.
results.name: Women's trail running/hiking group

results.description:
Hello my name is Raj and I am the organizer for Hoboken Jersey City'n Around Women's Group. As a girl who loves making friends and socializing I couldn't find a meetup for casual social lounge arounds. Most groups are happy hour party or toddler mommy focused. Hey what about us girls who want to make real friends, who do real stuff that are as diverse as the emotions we have?! 

Are you New to the area? Have your friends moved away? Got married? Had kids? This group is for ladies who are single, married or divorced, who want to have some fun and not just make new friends but also make friends for a lifetime. Having a hobby or a full time job or being a mother is great but time to time we all crave to just hang out with a few like minded folks to just chit chat over a cuppa coffee or go out with occasionally. We'll go to the movies, museums, farmers markets, dine out in local restaurants, try different cuisines , go out bicycling kayaking, plan picnics, happy hours and hey hey ! Ladies nights will always be welcome. In other words this is a social group that doesn't just focus on one thing. 

This group is created to provide a way to meet women mainly between the ages of 25 - 50 who can meet and simply be sociable. Women from any background are welcome to join. 


 *Members should understand and agree that they will be obligated to pay for their own expenses including food or drinks they have in the meetup(unless specifically mentioned in the particular meetup)

*As a member of this group you are not allowed to solicit other members for your products, business or services. NO EXCEPTIONS! This is a Meetup for fun lets keep it that way.

* If you RSVP for a meet you are expected to show up.

*No shows will be strictly not tolerated! You have to inform at least 24 hours in advance.

Liability Waiver: You agree to participate completely at your own risk and understand that you are taking full responsibility for your own safety and well being at all times
results.name: Hoboken Jersey City N around Women's Group

results.description:
When first signing up for ID purpose please provide a photo of yourself in your profile thank you. We are a 60+ social group of cyclists who enjoy riding together along the many miles of 'road' available in Westchester. From Bronx River Parkway Bicycle Sundays to The Walkway over the Hudson destination of the Duchess Rail Trail, there are many trails, Called the South and North County bike paths, and safe roadways waiting for us in the Bronx,Westchester and Putnam County and beyond. 

We offer rides at all levels, from the beginner’s level to the advance +level 

We will have bike tours every now and then on a weekend throughout the season 

We will also post after work rides: (we called it ride and eat rides) in the summer. 

With weather permitting we post a average of two to three events a week including weekends.   

The group will have a beginning of the season get together and an end of the season get together.

We, each, individually challenge ourselves to keep a competitive pace, recognizing a diversity of limits, and still take time to stop and smell the roses. Most all events allow for time to socialize, grab a bite to eat, and encourage the bond that comes with riding together.

We are not a professional organization, just a group of like minded individuals who share an interest in cycling.  When you RSVP YES for an event, you agree to be responsible for your own safety and your guest and , your equipment, and hold no one else liable for any accident, injury or event.

For great inspiration and a taste of how much  we love cycling and want you to love it too, see this amazing introduction by Tom: http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Social-Cycling/messages/boards/thread/26306702

results.description:
We're a Meet-Up group created to focus on having fun outings like lunches, dinners, movies, and we'd like to even organize trips to museums and art shows. We also can take the time to discuss internal and external disabilities and the challenges that go with them, but we also want to have fun first and foremost since from experience we know how much a serious condition takes on your social life. We feel that as important as discussions are, so is keeping our social lives active.

So along with discussing our challenges and trading histories, and maybe even learning some new coping mechanisms, we want this group to have fun and exciting excisions, to have people meet new friends and possibly even have some members meet friends that last a life-time.

We want to emphasize that we're going to not just focus on what we cannot do, but focus on what we can do to live life to it's fullest. We can even plan group events we didn't consider possible individually but together, maybe we can make it a possibility. We want a chance to come together in spite of the challenges, and together share suggestions for helping each other in welcoming more fun and socializing into our lives. 

Please share your suggestions for Meet-Ups with us, we're open to anything and everything within reason. We hope you'll join us, and thank you for your time. We hope you feel well and have a wonderful day!

Susanna & Adam - I Love Life! - Brooklyn, NY

results.description:
CLARITY STATEMENT: My intention for this group was to gather with other Deadheads in Recovery in our homes or otherwise drug and alcohol free settings to listen to Grateful Dead Music, or watch Grateful Dead video, while we socialize around the music, recovery, finger foods, etc.... A hangout of sorts. 


Wharf Rats are a group of concert-goers who have chosen to live drug and alcohol free.

Their primary purpose is to support other concert goers who choose to live drug-free, like themselves. They announce their presence with yellow balloons, signs, and the Wharf Rats information table. At a set break during Grateful Dead (and related) concerts they would hold 12-step style meetings but are not affiliated specifically with any 12-Step organization and have no requirement for attendance at one of their meetings besides providing some helpful sober fellowship.

The Wharf Rats see themselves as "a group of friends sharing a common bond, providing support, information and some traction in an otherwise slippery environment."

In starting this Meetup Group, I'm hoping to have Meetups where we can gather and listen to and/or watch Grateful Dead and related music or videos in a safe and clean environment. Food, Fun and Fellowship.
results.name: East Coast Wharf Rats

results.description:
This Meetup is to bring Socionics to the people of New York City. Socionics is similar to the Myers Briggs Type Indicator, only a lot more advanced to better explain personality type and inter-type relationships.

Socionics is a personality typology developed in the 1970s and '80s by the Lithuanian researcher Dr. Aušra Augustinavičiūtė. Socionics is based on Jung's personality type theory, Freud's theory of the conscious and unconscious, and Antoni Kepinski's theory of information metabolism. Since its inception, it has been developed by a variety of Russian researchers like Gulenko. The name "socionics" is derived from the word "society", because Augustinavičiūtė believed that each personality type has a distinct purpose in society, which can be described and explained by Socionics. 

The most interesting part of Socionics is dedicated to the intertype relations research. Each personality type, according to Socionics, has a specific core relationship to each other personality type. The theory suggests that some personality types are more and the others are less psychologically compatible based on their personality differences. Socionics dating grows in popularity day by day as more people learn about this intertype relationship theory and gain valuable insights in their private and working relationships. This group is for people to learn and discuss Socionics for the purpose of self-typing and self-discovery, to find the right partner whether it is for a short or long term relationship, to improve their current social, familial, and romantic relationships, and most definitely to connect to other people who are interested in examining their lives and relationships through the Socionical lens.

With this group, you'll be able to find out your Socionics type and learn more about your strengths, values and attitudes towards the world around you, and how you interact with those of different types. 

To find out more about Socionics, check out our Introduction to Socionics.

We also have a Facebook group.

Be sure to join our wider community at World Socionics Society.

Finally PLEASE support our meetup group by pledging a pound or two per month at our Patreon page.
results.name: New York City Socionics Society

If you are a woman in NYC looking to build relationships, advance your career, collaborate on ideas or simply learn more about UX, you've come to the right place!

results.description:
Got an interesting problem that your engineering group has solved that:

• You're embarrassed happened in the first place?

• Wouldn't fill a 50 minute talk?

• Defies slides and all rational talk expectations?

• You can't talk about to the world, but would gladly bend the rules over beers to a few talented and like minded typists such as yourself?

Then I Got 99 Issues But This Pull Request Ain't One is for you! We get together monthly and watch a short 30 minute-ish presentation (no slides required) about an interesting or unusual engineering problem your group has tackled.

And then we drink and be merry.

Here are the group guidelines:

• Eligible companies can send a small-ish number of engineers to any one of our meetups. Try to send someone to every one, otherwise the rest of us will get lonely.

• A company becomes eligible by giving a talk, or being scheduled to give a talk. Companies should give talks roughly once a year.

• Target talks towards technical audience.

• Talk in depth. We don't need yet another "how we deploy" or "how we used Angular to..." spiel.

• Of course you're hiring. No need to mention it, and no poaching either.

We're currently collecting members and will plan out the next few months of talks. Stay tuned for the first meetup!
results.name: I Got 99 Issues But This Pull Request Ain't One

results.description:
This group is for young women in the NYC/NJ area who have been diagnosed and/or struggle with any kind of mental illness or disorder. A peer support group, NYC Depression Support For Young Women is a safe space to socialize in casual settings with others who can relate to your struggles.

Group meetings will be held up to twice a month, where we can gather together and chat over how things are going for us. Activities will range from picnics/food outings, happy hour, bowling, movie nights, etc.

Though this is a group for mental health support, if you are having an emergency or need long term support, please see a professional. Helpful websites and resources will be provided via a link very soon.

If there are any topics that are a trigger for you, please feel free to let us know and we will be respectful of your triggers.


PLEASE NOTE: While the group is for women in their"20's and 30's," the age range is somewhat loose. If anyone in their late teens are interested for instance, they are more than welcome to join. The term "women" is also used loosely, as gender fluid and genderqueer individuals are welcome as well.

About Metis:

Metis accelerates the careers of data scientists. Located in both New York City and San Francisco, we offer immersive bootcamps and evening courses designed by world-class industry practitioners.

The Metis Data Science Bootcamps deliver in-person instruction, ongoing career coaching and job placement support. The bootcamps run for 12 weeks, Monday through Friday, from 9 am - 6 pm. The Metis Data Visualization with D3.js courses are part-time and held in the evenings.

results.description:
To All:

The Astoria Lovers Mystery Book Club is for people of all ages who want to join a mystery book club.

Even though my meetup group is based in Astoria, everyone from the outer boroughs is more then welcome to attend one of my monthly mystery book club meetups.

Check out the meetup website calendar after joining, to see what we will be reading, or go into the photo album and check out in order of month, what books have been selected for the months ahead.

I have just two important rules for this meetup group and they are as follows:

1) When joining you need to post a current picture of yourself.

2)  If for some reason you have accepted an invitation to one of my events and then can not attend you need to go back in and cancel your attendance and if you do not I will then have no choice but to remove you from this meetup group after three no shows.

So with that said, thank you for taking the time to look at this meetup website, and I hope that you will join,  "Astoria Mystery Lovers Book Club".

Best Regards,

Donna

Chief Organizer

results.description: This group is for those who want to do more in life by ridding themselves of unecessary things and continue their journey by eventually becoming a minamilst. We all at some point of time have asked ourselves, why did i buy this? or why am I here? Are you guilty of waking up three times a week after beating the heck out of the alarm clock for that dead end job called a career and asking yourself as you sit in your office, Why am I here? What about that relationship? have you been asking yourself that question as well ?. That's many of us, we want to let go but just cant, we need to let go of that clutter (clothes, magazines, paper pile up, the 6 jars of jelly that have no place in your kitchen) Whatever it may be, learning to live with less especially stress will not just make you happy but will add years to your life. Join us so that we can learn from each other that it's ok to let go of your vintage Jordache jeans, well maybe not the vintage Jordache jeans, you cant find those anymore. But you dont need another pair just because their on sale and your pockets are full with store coupons. Lets become clutter free, debt free, less stressed, more involved, so we can make room for what's really important in order to live life to the fullest.
results.name: Living With Less

results.description:
Come practice yoga! Classes are instructed by Yoga Alliance teachers with over 500 hours of training and at least 500 hours of teaching experience. Channel your energy and power to tone your body, calm your mind, and discover your true potential!

Yoga can be expensive, so I'm hoping to create a yoga community at a more reasonable price. This will be a more accessible way to practice more often in a fun environment while getting together and getting healthy :) We're a fun bunch of a solid 5-10 regulars; newbies are always welcome!

A note on dues:

I keep the balance sheet public, so you can see this is definitely not a money-making venture - but in order to keep class rates low, we have monthly dues of $10 in addition to the class fee of $10.  We need to be sure that studio rent is covered every month, and this helps ensure your friendly yoga teacher doesn't pay out of her pocket ;) 

The going rate for yoga memberships at studios is well over $100 per month, and a drop-in class is usually about $20 - although our overhead is much lower, it still costs money to run classes. Even if you only come to class twice a month, it ends up being $15 per class - and if you come to 8, it ends up being less than $12 each! Dues can be paid online or in person, and everyone has a generous trial to decide if it's worthwhile - most of our yogis attest that it is!

See you on the mat!

ॐ
results.name: Affordable Community Yoga Classes! (North NJ)

topics.name: What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
Let's face it, we all want to be happy! Happiness doesn't have a sell by date or a certain framework that it fits in, we want to be happy no matter where and when. So why are so many of us chasing the elusive dream of happiness? Why are people more unhappy than ever before? 

The good news is, one of the biggest emerging sciences is the Science of Happiness. Through careful and precise uncovering of this research, and implementation of some simple tools, we can all live happy and healthy lives, everywhere, all the time. 

Our meetings include thought-provoking presentations, guided workshops, games, roundtable discussions, and more – all geared to establishing positive connection between people. Each meeting creates a unique and profound sensation that brings all participants to a lasting, positive, and elevated state.

Let's get started!

results.description:
HR Girlfriends is a networking community for women working in or providing services to the Human Resources field, who are looking for an environment to socially and professionally collaborate. The community provides a welcoming environment, promoting authentic networking amongst open minded professionals. HR Girlfriends knows no color lines and ALL women are welcome!

New to HR/Want into HR?

HR is a large career track with several options (Benefits, Recruiting, Training, etc). Navigating the landscape of HR can be daunting, but HR Girlfriends makes it easy for you. We offer a learning path for our members that will teach you core HR skills to navigate any new role, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. You'll also learn the skills necessary to land the HR job you seek. See more information below to explore membership.  

HR Pros

I have nothing left to learn, said no smart person ever! The HR Girlfriends community is a great resource for the Girlfriend who is experienced in HR, but desires career advancement. We offer training and resources to sharpen your soft and hard skills, not to mention the community of Girlfriends on hand to share their inside knowledge. Many of our trainings are certified through HRCI & SHRM. See more information below to explore membership.  

MEMBERSHIP

Joining the HR Girlfriends meetup.com group does not constitute paid membership into the community. Membership can be explored by visiting our website at www.HRGirlfriends.com. 

Social Media 

We have an active LinkedIn group that provides the support every woman in HR wants and needs. Also, check us out on Facebook and Twitter.
results.name: HR Girlfriends NYC

topics.name: Introduction to Stand Up Paddle Boarding

results.description: This group is dedicated to the beginning of VeloPaddling sport in the metro area/Lower Hudson Valley area. VeloPaddler's are dedicated to balanced participation in full body endurance cadence strokes. Equal amounts of spinning a Bicycle combined with equal amounts of Stand Up Paddling on water. Proficiency with both strokes combined into one day or work out is exhilarating and sustainable not to mention a complete full body fitness program that will delight your summer, late spring and early fall. VeloPaddler's use any bike and a light weight trailer plus an Inflatable Stand Up Paddle Board. The cycling route is planned with adequate time given for the paddling and return cycle trip. Cycling Lycra with a little additional Kayak clothing is all you need as far as clothing. A water sock or moccasin is recommended. VeloPaddling is new and we aim to be very helpful to beginners. Cyclist or Paddler or neither. Come learn and try in tiny successful fun bits. Most of all we want you to experience the full door to door round trip motor experience. We came from 11 years of USA Cycle road racing 20 years of NYC Club Rising and now 3 years of SUP paddling on all local water ways. We provide certified instruction in both activities. This is endurance sport. Hydration and nutrition same as doing 50-100 mile cycle road riding and big open water crossings apply. We can structure beginners and advanced on separate days. Fun and a successful bonk free journey is the key. Steady Eddie wins the day.
results.name: NYC Area VeloPaddling, Equal Parts  Cycling & SUP on Water

results.description:
Open Data is a transformational trend in Open Governance that is generating empowerment and economic growth. Around the world, cities, states, and nations are publishing Open Data and creating new data supply chains and ecosystems that are managing scarce water resources, improving land use and agricultural security, enhancing transportation and traffic flows, and generating new high-tech jobs and tax revenues. Governments themselves are benefiting because published Open Data is free of organizational barriers that hold back departments from sharing information and collaborating.

This Group is designed to be interactive, informative, and fun. It will involve diverse skills and experiences, and showcase real live examples of how Open Data works, African Challenges and opportunities, and example applications. There will be online and real face to face meetups and conferences, online collaboration in global communities working to help Africa become a leader in Open Government and Open Data. Our goal is to create new global relationships that bring passionate Open Data communities together to share common challenges and build new solutions. It doesn't matter where you live, where you were born, or where you work. We are looking for Citizens of the World to work together to help African countries embrace Open Government and Open Data.
results.name: Africa Open Data

results.description:
Nu Brand Gaming LLC. in Brooklyn, New York, is a hobby center dedicated primarily to supporting the Tabletop Strategist gaming community. Our goal is to keep tabletop gaming alive by reaching out to those involved in the hobby while encouraging others to join in.

FIVE (5) semi-private rooms with TEN (10) playing tables, a vibrant community, discounts on purchases for members, and enough terrain in-house to reproduce a state (a small one, like Rhode Island). 

We play Malifaux, Warhammer, Warhammer40k, Netrunner, Infinity, Warmachine, Relic Knights etc, x wing...anything you can think of. We have bring your own beer nights and we hold tournaments.

What are you waiting for? We are organizing to PLAY. Come on down and join us to play, watch, or learn one of a dozen miniature wargames being played tonite. The atmosphere is warm, the people are friendly. If you like wargaming, and live in NYC, you will love coming in and playing with us here in Brooklyn!

Nu Brand Gaming, bringing enemies together since 1776. (rough estimate)

results.description:
With all of the features and benefits of Microsoft SharePoint, you don’t have to be a programmer or “techie” to take advantage of its capabilities. The mission of this LISTnet SIG (Special Interest Group) is to spread knowledge and understanding of SharePoint and related technologies to Long Island’s information workers, business end-users, and organizational administrators and managers.

SharePoint helps individuals and teams work better, faster, and smarter. With SharePoint, you can access the right people and information at the right time to make better decisions and get your job done. Plus, users can work comfortably and confidently in SharePoint with a familiar interface and direct connections to Microsoft Office.

Whether you are just exploring SharePoint for the first time, a business user tasked with organizing documents in SharePoint, a manager looking for a solution to a business challenge, or a seasoned site administrator, this group will allow you to network with and learn from your peers.

Developers and technologists are encouraged to join and participate in our meetings.

We are always looking for speakers and sponsors to join our meetings to share their experience and expertise.
results.name: SharePoint SIG - LISTnet (Long Island, NY)

results.description:
Welcome to the premier Hindu/Vedic group in NYC!  Join us as we together discover the oldest and richest spiritual tradition on planet earth! 

• Learn the secrets to success in all dimensions of life through applying the knowledge and meditation techniques from the original Vedic & Yogic texts!

• Enjoy regular satsangs on life solutions from the great Enlightened Spiritual Masters from the Hindu/Vedic Tradition!

• Participate in pujas, kirtans, chanting and other temple rituals to connect with the divine cosmic energy!

• Celebrate holidays and special events with fellow seekers!

Hinduism originally came from the rich Vedic tradition, established thousands of years ago. The Vedic tradition is more than a religion, it is a way of life based on enlightened consciousness! We stand out from other groups because we base our Hindu practice directly from the source - the rich Vedic tradition, today known as Sanatana Hindu Dharma - which itself is based on the original ancient Sanskrit texts of all the great enlightened Masters from the beginning of time – i.e. Shiva sutras, Brahma Sutras to Patanjali Sutras, Bhagavad-Gita as well as teachings from modern-day living Masters! 

Our Meetup is devoted to bringing together people, who want to learn about, celebrate and enjoy all the wonderful aspects of the Hindu/Vedic culture and apply it to our modern day lives! We meet Sunday afternoons in Midtown Manhattan for powerful group Vedic meditations and Saturday evenings at our base location – New York Varanasi Temple in Queens – an auspicious place housing energized deities and a Shiva lingam for weekly puja/kirtan/satsangs.  Please CLICK HERE for our Queens group.   We also hold other special events in and around NYC. Join us as we explore and share the rich Hindu/Vedic tradition together!
results.name: NYC Hindu/Vedic Meditation & Spirituality

results.description:
LaunchNJ: Women Entrepreneurs' Hub is for women entrepreneurs, professionals and everyone else interested in working towards identification of specific causes, challenges and their remediation collectively with other fellow women entrepreneurs. Join us to connect with other women entrepreneurs and share what resources work best for women.  

Vision

LaunchNJ: Women  Entrepreneurs' Hub is committed to supporting women entrepreneurs and their business endeavors by providing a safe and supportive environment to share, collaborate, connect, and mentor one another.  Launch NJ Women strives to provide access to a community of fellow women entrepreneurs as well as experts who may be able to supply insights or contacts to help you achieve your business goals. Areas of focus include: 

1.   Identifying and pitching funding sources.

2.  Building the right team to support your business growth

3.  Creating an MVP (Minimally Viable Product)

4.  Developing actionable plans to move forward LaunchNJ Women will offer structured ongoing support through a variety of means including workshops, on-line training and business coaching. 

Our work ethic and what can you do to get most out of Launch NJ: Women Entrepreneurs' Hub?

Our goal is to grow the community of women entrepreneurs in NJ. In order to achieve this goal, we want to make sure that our events and activities work for you directly and guide you now with your present needs as well as with your long term strategy. The more you participate in this group, the more you will benefit from the group. So, we want to hear from you and know about you. This will help us tailor our activities to meet your needs. Tell us about yourself by filling out the form and get started. 

This group is for women and men entrepreneurs and service providers to share and network, with a focus on women's needs.  We'll also feature speakers who can educate us on various programs for entrepreneurs in the area.

We encourage you to complete the introductory questions when you sign up. That will help us to customize our offerings to better serve you. Thanks!
results.name: LaunchNJ: Women Entrepreneurs' Hub

The goal of this group is to create a team of professionals who will help each other. We will frequently have an open forum where business owners can raise roadblocks they are facing and let the group weigh in to see how we can help.

So come to our next meetup. Let's make a group of entrepreneurs, business owners, and client based businesses, who can guide and support each other like a team!

Who am I?

I am Alex Mazza a Health Coach, in Manhattan, with clients all around the country. I gained my certification from the MacDonald Center for Obesity Prevention & Education at Villanova University College of Nursing.

results.description:
InTandem is a 501c3 not-for-profit organization that provides tandem bike riding programs to people with disabilities in the New York City area.  We conduct regular weekly rides on Saturday mornings and Thursday evenings, weather and season permitting, in Central Park and participate frequently in organized rides throughout the New York City area.  

Our members are predominantly individuals with visual or developmental disabilities.  They ride on the back of the tandem bikes. We call them stokers. Our captains, who ride the front seat, are all volunteers from the community.  InTandem pays all related program costs for our stokers and captains.  We also have non-riding volunteer opportunities – from helping at the rides, watching and walking guide dogs, and with management and growth of the organization.  

No prior tandem riding experience is necessary. However, we do ask that our volunteer captains be experienced and confident cyclists, that they be comfortable riding a bike for at least forty miles, and be comfortable riding in NYC traffic. We provide captain training and orientation prior to riding with our members.
results.name: InTandem: Tandem riding for people with disabilities

For example, we show up in Union Square with flowers that we give to random strangers on the street, with a smile and maybe a hug. As you've understood, some spending of money may be part of some of our "hits" but we will keep it at a minimum. The opportunities for good-doing are endless and I would be greatful if you let me hear your ideas, especially ones that involves low-cost to no-cost spending since most of us are struggling financially ourselves. • Shared best practices in programming statistical software, such as package development (in R) or macros (in SAS)
• Training, including the latest in techniques, tips and tricks
      o For beginners only
      o Master class
• Current issues in modeling
• Providing networking opportunities to learn more about what our colleagues are doing
• Employment and professional discussions with our “recruiters in residence”: informative discussions on the state of the analytics
      o Skills in demand

When it comes to software we’re relatively agnostic, but want to be practical to get the job done, and will use whatever it takes.

BNI Crossroads welcomes business representatives and business owners to join in every Wednesday morning as we work to build relationships that lead to increased business through warm referrals and introductions. The group was established 10+ years ago and typically has 20-40 business professionals in attendance every week. Stop by for breakfast at the Tom Sawyer Diner in Paramus, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. BNI Crossroads is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally as it's somewhat like having a sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team! 

We are BNI-affiliated, value the philosophy of "Givers Gain", and are committed to helping one another succeed. BNI chapters are allowed to have only one profession to avoid conflict - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business - effectively locking out the competition. Please feel free to contact us to see if your category is currently open in our chapter! To see which categories we already have filled go to our BNI Crossroads website. 

We are actively looking for the following categories: Advertising, Air/Water Purification, Alternative Energy, Architect, Carpet Cleaner, Florist, Electrician, Contractor Carpenter, Handyman, Massage Therapist, Payroll Service, Restoration Damage and Cleanup, and Yoga Instructor.

results.description:
We are exploring answers for questions such as: How do you know that the data you are looking at is the data you think you are looking at? How fast can a domain expert, but very likely a technical layperson, get understandable answers to his/her questions if there are so many ways and places where your data is stored? How you make sure that your reports will not be disrupted when you change any of the internal systems to a different kind?


Data Brewery is a knowledge sharing and sometimes lightly hacking community around data warehousing and its application. Anyone is welcome, whether you have small data or big data, whether your data is open or not, whether you are non-profit organisation or a corporation.


The topics are mostly about master data management, data quality, conceptual data modelling, metadata and ETL. We bring together data users (not necessarily with technical background) and data engineers to share their stories, ask questions and come up with solutions. 


From time-to-time we will also be talking about or lightly hacking on data warehousing libraries and applications. We are putting together a collection of open-source tools that anyone would be able to use to help them with their data problems. Language of our choice is Python.
results.name: New York Data Brewery

results.description:
The Empire Skate Club of New York (www.empireskate.org) is a non-profit organization of inline skaters dedicated to having fun while skating and improving the skating environment in New York. We organize social skates and get-togethers in the city, trips around the eastern seaboard and farther afield, clinics, seminars, parties and promote skate advocacy. We provide discounts at skating stores, discounted subscriptions to skating magazines, and occasionally give our members free merchandise from our sponsors. For a full list of membership benefits, visit the membership page on our website. 

Evening/Night Skates are a great way to meet people. Our Tuesday Night Skate, New York's longest running night skate, is for more experienced skaters who want to experience all the thrills of skating in and around the five boroughs at night. We also always join the Wednesday Night Skate leaving every Wednesday at 8 pm from Union Square South. This skate is for intermediate skaters who are comfortable skating in traffic (And it's a blast!!!). 

Day Skates are longer trips, usually half to a full day long, to Coney Island, CT Beaches, Westchester Trails or along the Jersey Palisades (for example), and are for intermediate level skaters. Possible day-long skates might involve hopping aboard a commuter train and heading off to a skating place in nearby Westchester, Long Island or southwestern Connecticut. Our leaders are experienced skaters who have done these routes many times. Benefit from their experience and discover places you otherwise might never have thought about reaching on skates. It's fun and easy! 

Skating Trips to other cities are weekend long trips providing the opportunity to skate, party & socialize with hundreds of our skater friends from all around the country (and beyond) in Philadelphia, Boston, Washington DC, Miami and elsewhere. Our own version of this is The Big Apple Roll (BAR), usually the first weekend of August each year. Check out photos and video at empireskate.org or bigappleroll.org.
results.name: Empire Skate Club of New York (www.empireskate.org)

results.description: FREE YOGA FOR SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS and SPOUSES Mission: To provide wellness programs that enhance the lives of veterans, service members, and their families. Vision To support the well being of veterans, service members, and their families in communities nationwide. Connected Warriors is a community based volunteer organization providing free, trauma-conscious yoga therapy for service members, veterans and their families in the United States. Connected Warriors was founded in August 2011 by a group of professionals and yoga teachers in the South Florida area who, as long time practitioners themselves, know the powerfully beneficial effects of this ancient system. Connected Warriors has established a nationwide network that includes 568 Certified Yoga Teachers who volunteer their time and talents to instruct classes at local yoga studios, community veteran centers and other donated spaces. As of July 2013, we conduct approximately 175 classes each month with an attendance of about 1,000 participants. Therapeutic yoga practices, including relaxation and meditation, are a valuable treatment component for post traumatic stress and other trauma-related psycho-emotional difficulties. Overseas deployments can affect service members, veterans and their families for years. Participants of our current classes learn how to handle stressful situations in a more relaxed manner by quieting and focusing their mind, which encourages positive thoughts and self-acceptance.
results.name: Free Yoga for Veterans & their families

results.description:
"Passion For Compassion" Benefit!  An event to support the Physicians' Committee for Responsible Medicine in the Hamptons on August 9.  Dr. Neal Barnard will be speaking, music by DJ Stretch Armstrong, catering by Suite Three Oh Six.  Silent auction items available at the event and online at:  http://www.32auctions.com/pcrmhamptons

Please visit PCRM.org to learn more about this wonderful organization that promotes an end to animal testing, more and better veg lunches in schools, education on veg diets for doctors, and veg dietary information for those with cancer and diabetes.  

PCRM Organization
Since 1985, the Physicians Committee has been influencing advancements in medicine and science. We advocate for preventive medicine, especially good nutrition, conduct clinical research, and advocate for higher ethical standards in research. Our membership includes 150,000 health care professionals and concerned citizens.

We encourage higher standards for ethics and effectiveness in research:
We oppose unethical human experiments. While great strides have been made in eliminating such experiments, problems remain. For example, children are still given synthetic growth hormone in experiments to make them taller, and both children and adults are exposed to unnecessary new drugs which have toxic effects.

We promote alternatives to animal research and animal testing. We have worked to put a stop to gruesome experiments, such as the military’s cat-shooting studies, DEA narcotics experiments, and monkey self-mutilation projects. 

We also promote nonanimal methods in medical education. Currently, more than three-quarters of all U.S. medical schools have dropped their animal labs for medical students.

The Physicians Committee has led the way for reforms of federal nutrition policies.  Our clinical research programs are breaking new ground in diabetes, cancer, and other serious conditions.  PCRM’s Cancer Project has provided vital information to tens of thousands of people.

The New Four Food Groups is the Physicians Committee's innovative proposal for a federal nutrition policy that puts a new priority on health.

Our public service announcement series features medical experts on prevention and health.

The Physicians Committee is a nonprofit 501c3 organization headquartered in Washington, D.C.
results.name: PCRM Benefit & Auction with Dr. Neal Barnard in Amagansett

results.description:
ABOUT US

HackerNest is a grassroots nonprofit organization that runs unpretentious community events and epic, meaningful, universally-acclaimed hackathons. Our mission is economic development through technological proliferation. Check us out >>> Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma. We cram smart, accomplished techies into a room, often with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups and growing quite quickly internationally. Our membership is diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, hear the occasional speaker or watch a demo, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends.

Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks. We're not scienticians, but this seems to work. We became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally. Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. We hail the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it, so we have a strict no-douchebag policy.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ. Whoa, longest description evaaar. Need to know more? Here's some answers. 

RSVP to get a custom, hand-written nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :)


Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

SOME DETAILS:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer types - PHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure, interesting, hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be.

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack) - coder/developer/programmer/designer, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty - biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer - network/network/system/IT administrator - front/back-end specialist - angel investor - demon investor - venture capitalist - venture communist - tech enthusiast - tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist - OCD blogger/Tweeter - bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers - internet mogul - nerd/geek/freak/tweak - entrepreneur - SEO/SEM pro - writer/project manager/business analyst - 1337 individual - etc., etc.


...and aren't a douchebag. <3

New to Hoboken? Need to make new or more female friendships in the neighborhood? This is the group for that! LADIES ONLY GROUP.

• I decided to start this group because I recently moved to Hoboken and meeting new girlfriends in the area is hard to do! The mid 20s to mid 30s is also a tough stage in which it is hard to juggle in the ever important girl time because of (work, marriage, kids, etc). 

• Why mermaids you ask? Well Mermaids are creatures associated with femininity. Hoboken is near the water, it caught your attention and who wouldn't want to be called a mermaid? Haha-so it works ;) 

• Whether you are single or in a relationship, have kids or don't as long as you want to make some new female connections in Hoboken, this group is for you! 

So let's walk the waterfront, visit the food trucks on the pier, shop on Washington, laugh over cocktails and so much more!


*If for any reason you can not make it to an event after you have RSVP'd, Please update your status or send me a message. Thank you :) I understand things come up, but it is not fair to the group members attending an event to be waiting around for a member who never shows up.  So new policy is 3 no shows and you are out of the group. 

*Events are kept small, so you have the opportunity to talk and actually connect with potential friends.  I'll schedule large group events, every few months or so.

results.description:
As of July 28, 2014, The Temple of Hecate, Inc. was the first incorporated Temple dedicated to the Goddess Hecate in NYS.

The temple was founded by Directors: Laurie Bizzarro, Gary Suto, JSterling Hurley, Matthew Sawicki, Mario Pabón Andraca,  and Anna Lewis.

We are here and open to All who wish to worship, whether alone or collectively, in a sacred space devoted to Our Great Mother. While the temple, located in Staten Island by the ferry,  is under construction, we will continue to hold rituals at Catland and other venues to enable the community to gather together in worship. We Honor and welcome any and all traditions who wish to use the space and join with others in the name of Hecate.

About Our Directors:

C. LAURIE BIZZARRO

C. Laurie Bizzarro aka Lady Thalestris is a Daughter of Hecate and the High Priestess of “Enchanted Crossroads Coven and Grove.” She began practicing Wicca in 2003.  She trained with “Wiccans of the Crossroads,” and was initiated in the Crossroads tradition (Witches/Wiccans of the Crossroads) as a Third Degree High Priestess and Daughter of Hecate on May 30, 2009. She was High Priestess of “Wiccans of the Crossroads” from 2007 until she formed “Enchanted Crossroads Coven and Grove” in 2012. She has organized and lead rituals at various festivals and in the Tri-State area, including organizing and leading the current Open Monthly Hecate Rituals held at Catland in Bushwick, Brooklyn. She has lectured at the college level on the subject of Wicca and Paganism and has organized a lecture series for the same.  She is the proprietor of “The Law Office of C. Laurie Bizzarro, P.C.” representing Plaintiffs in personal injury, construction accidents and Employment Discrimination cases.

GARY SUTO

Gary Suto grew up with Hungarian/Gypsy Grandparents and was surrounded with Astrology, Palmistry, Cardomancy and Numerology. He would not consider himself a Hereditary Witch, but very close to it. He has been practicing divination for 35 years, and his skills include Tarot, Iching, Numerology, Runes and Palmistry. He is a  High Priest of Temenos Ophiuchus, a grove of the Minoan Brotherhood; High Priest in NY Coven of Witches, a coven of the Wica Tradition, initiated by Lady Rhea; Founder of NY Gay Men's Open Pagan Circle; Co-creator of NY LGBT Open Pagan Circle; Co-founder of Prometheus Rising, Queer Men's Pagan Festival; Past Instructor at the Pagan Center of NY, Psychic Reader and life coach at Magickal Realms and Catland Bookstore;  He has given workshops and led rituals at various festivals and NYC locations. Hecate came to him at one of these festivals approximately 13 years ago and has been one of his main Deities ever since. On a mundane level he is a fashion designer and graphic designer. He is putting those skills to use in creating Pagan Clothing and Jewelry as well as a Tarot deck that will incorporate the Iching.

JSTERLING HURLEY

From his early childhood JSterling had a connection to the plants and animals who inhabited the woods surrounding his parent’s farm in central Ohio. He was raised in an agnostic home with no formal spiritual guidance which allowed him to explore his own spiritual path as a young adult.

As an out gay youth he worked against homophobia and charted his way through hostile environments and helped other gay youth through violence, ignorance and hate.

JSterling is a High Priest of the Minoan Fellowship Tradition and is priest of the Minoan Brotherhood. He is a green witch and has used his knowledge of plants, aromatherapy and herbology both in his magickal and mundane life. He strives to provide a venue for the LGBT pagan community to become empowered and to reclaim their place as healers, shamans and guides of the dead.  Throughout all his training both formal and informal the constant has been the connection to his patron Goddess, Hekate. For within himself She shines through. From the wisdom of the darkness She shine light. And from the potential locked within us all she provides the key of fullness.

MARIO PABON ANDRACA

‎Mario Pabón Andraca has been a practicing pagan for over fifteen years. After being a solitary practitioner for a few years, Mario joined a Wiccan coven of the Gardnerian tradition called Polyhymnia Coven in New York City. He is now a Third Degree High Priest in this Coven.

In 2012, after his first encounter with Hekate, Mario joined Arn Draiocht Fein (ADF), and successfully completed their Dedicants' program. Currently he is pursuing ADF's Clergy Training. Currently he holds the position of Scribe in the New York City Grove "Inis Ull".

Mario has also recently joined both the Sorita D'Este's Covenant of Hekate, and Hellenion, a Greek Reconstructionis religious organization. Mario discovered Hekate in the Between the Worlds festival where she came to him and guided him to where he is today. His path is mostly Hellenic in private practice, while still teaching Wicca and leading a coven. Most recently he has been given the responsibility to lead and officiate the central Hekate rituals in the very same festival where she first came to him.

MATTHEW SAWICKI

Matthew Sawicki is a Traditional Witch and lifelong devotee of Hecate. He hails from the mountains of North Eastern Pennsylvania and learned much of his craft and magick from his upbringing there. Matthew has been initiated into three separate traditions of the craft, most notably The New York Wica Tradition where he is a 3rd Degree High Priest, The Minoan Brotherhood and the non-wiccan tradition of The Clan of Tubal Cain out of the UK, which remains his main focus and current tradition. Matthew has been a Priest of Hecate whose public rites have led people to her for over 10 years. Matthew is known for his "Rites of Crossroads" rituals at the Between the Worlds Men's Gathering in Ohio that has brought more than 80 men together in her worship. Matthew lives in New York City and looks forward to continuing his work as a priest of Hecate to those who seek her.

ANNA LEWIS

Anna Lewis, a NYC native Witch and Pagan is thrilled to be a part of the magick bringing The Temple of Hecate to light. She is a longtime friend of Lady Rhea, Magickal Realms and the NY Coven of Witches as well as Horn and Cauldron of Rhode Island. She currently lives in Rhode Island where she turns the wheel of the year with her young family, worships Yemaya in the sea by day and Hecate at the crossroads by night. She is grateful to the goddess for her many blessings and for the opportunity to aid others in their devotion.

Please join our meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/The-Temple-of-Hecate-Inc/ and facebook page https://www.facebook.com/groups/333721350124288/ (The Temple of Hecate, Inc.) for events and further information on the temple and our Directors. (website to follow-stay tuned!).

Bright Blessings to All! Hail Hecate!!!
results.name: The Temple of Hecate, Inc.

results.description:
This is a group for people who are "successful" according to society...  but don't feel that way.

For people who know there's something "more" ... but don't know what it looks like.

Who want to help others with their skills while making enough money to support themselves ... but don't know the path to get there.

You feel trapped, frustrated, and unfulfilled. And you're ready for a change.

And all you need is a new way to look at the world. A new perspective. One that will allow you to see the exciting opportunities all around you. Because you're currently walking by SO many opportunities every day for more excitement, happiness, and fulfillment NOW - not some far time off in the future when you finally "figure it all out."

Some things we'll cover together as part of the group:
How to see opportunities you're currently missing all around you.
How to understand what patterns, thoughts, and beliefs are keeping you stuck where you are.
How to choose new beliefs and let go of the old ones that are keeping you stuck.
How to trust your gut instinct and make decisions based on it (trusting your intuition).
How to drop your current BIG plan for happiness and replace it with exciting small next steps.
How to stop "trying" and "working so hard" to be happy and start allowing the happiness in. To simply "be."
How to build a bridge to your passions and purpose... without ever needing to know what they are.
How to be ready for the fear that comes up when making exciting choices outside your comfort zone.
How to fall in love with fear and make it forever your ally... not something you run from.

Together, these topics represent a new mindset... one that will allow you to be happier NOW while constantly moving towards an even more exciting life later. One you may not even be able to dream of just yet.

Because, as you take small steps outside your comfort zone, one at a time, you'll be introduced to new opportunities you can't even see right now. It's an exciting journey that will result in better relationships, better work, and a life you're excited for.

And why should you waste another day NOT being excited about life?!

I hope to see you at the next meetup so I can be part of YOUR journey.
results.name: The Opportunity Lens NJ: A new way to look at the world.

This is a small, select group of entrepreneurial and open-minded new or experienced small business owners who want to take their businesses to the next level in a supportive, friendly and sharing environment. 

The intention is that this group would be limited to no more than 10-15 people from a VARIETY of businesses who are committed to meeting once per month in a neutral, rotating location (Brooklyn and/or Manhattan, based on location of members) to share ideas, give honest and open feedback, share best practices, support one another, and help one another learn and grow their businesses!


I expect the meetings would be a mix of structured and unstructured discussion.  Note:  This is NOT a networking group, referrals among the group are NOT expected, and there is absolutely no pressure to share business.  The intention is to share ideas and best practices in a supportive environment!  Solicitation is prohibited, and anyone who does not respect these rules will be asked to leave the group.

topics.name: Be the Change You Wish to See in the World
Your Role in Addressing Climate Change

results.description:
Wondering what YOU can do about climate change? Join the thousands of Citizens Climate Lobby members who are actually moving Congress toward bold climate solutions that could change everything.
CCL will change the way you think about democracy. We're not about marches and protests-- we're about you talking directly to your Senators, Congressmen and their top advisers. If you want to make real change happen, this is an incredibly effective form of advocacy. You will be amazed at how much power you have as an informed and inspired citizen.
There are lots of ways you can inform and influence your members of Congress-- through letters, emails, phone calls, newspaper articles, and through live meetings with your Congressman, Senators and their advisers. We'll teach you how to do any or all of the above-- wherever your comfort zone takes you. And we'll inspire you to maximize your effectiveness as an advocate for real climate solutions.
Best of all, we have a plan and a solid climate proposal for Congress that's actually gaining bipartisan support on Capitol Hill. It is non-partisan, politically viable, scientifically sound, and economically feasible. Economists say it is the most cost efficient approach. Scientists say it is our best shot at saving the planet.
We think New York area citizens deserve a special seat at the table when climate change is being discussed because when it comes to climate impacts and sea-level rise, they have a lot at stake. So we are focused on uniting New York area  citizens this year. We already have established local CCL chapters in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens/Nassau, Staten Island, Long Island, Westchester, and Columbia counties in NY, as well as Albany, Buffalo, Ithaca, Red Hook, Rochester, Syracuse, and Utica, NY, in Fairfield County in Connecticut, and in Central New Jersey.
Join us for an introductory conference call or New York Area Local meeting near you!
Website info: http://www.CitizensClimateLobby.com
What does climate scientist Dr. James Hansen say about CCL?"Most impressive is the work of the Citizens Climate Lobby, a relatively new, fast-growing, nonpartisan, nonprofit group with [193] chapters across the United States and Canada. If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group."
Register with Citizens' Climate Lobby to learn even more and or join us at a meetup event.

Additional information: The Price of Carbon: The Price of Carbon:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kY-ZnpWbJdw

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: New York Area Citizens' Climate Lobby

results.description:
The purpose of this meet up is to help us:

a) better understand the craft of writing and its challenges and rewards; this means discussing theory, psychology, personal experiences, maybe even books!  p:

b) sit down and write!

YOU: 

You're good at writing (or so you've been told), or maybe you're a one hit wonder (that time you wrote that really good poem in middle school!). If you're bold enough to call yourself a writer, you just might be one. For some reason, however, you just can't seem to put that novel together. For some reason, your poems just...well, they don't make your blood flow the way they used to. You keep jumping medium to medium; you started with a novel about your dad's psychosis and now you've decided maybe a TV series on gentrification might be better.

You need new energy, new resolve. Just a little something to bring you to the edge and push you into the deepest depths of writer's waters... 

US:

What we'll do at the meetings is talk about our work/backgrounds/projects and then proceed to write for an hour to hour and a half, and then perhaps we'll each share for a few minutes and get some feedback and/or answer pointed questions by the speaker about their own work. ALL TYPES/NON-TYPES OF WRITERS WELCOME! Location TBD but tentatively Fair Weather Bushwick at 274 Wyckoff Ave; ideally we'd each buy a tea or whatever for using the space! 

Just as much as writing, this group is about friendship! Understanding each others' struggles as writers can in turn make us better writers ourselves. Committed attendance is highly encouraged. 

There will be a $1 fee to cover organizer dues. An envelope will go around at the end of each meet...
results.name: Bushwick Writers Meetup

results.description:
Please note, I do offer personal training services for one on one and partner work sessions. Additionally I offer in home training services if you have a fitness facility in your apartment building or house. Contact me for details.

Hi and welcome to my meetup for outdoor personal group fitness training. This group is open to anyone who is interested in improving their fitness, losing weight, getting stronger and becoming more flexible. My classes are primarily focused on quality, not quantity meaning I'm looking for proper form and technique while using full range of motion. Each exercise circuit is timed to ensure everyone goes at their own pace. I also use progression and regression methods based on fitness levels to ensure you are getting to most out your workout. I don't like to call my class boot camp because it sounds like a hard core, going all out until you puke class. Rather, I like to call it personal group training because its intimate in size and I can give the small groups of 10 or less individualized attention. Its like having a personal trainer for a fraction of the cost!
results.name: LYFT group fitness training of White Plains

results.description:
This group is for nice people who have an interest and/or experience in Thai/kick boxing. Meetups will involve mostly: stretching, warm-ups, skipping rope, work on focus pads, and light sparring. I (the founder of this group) have very modest martial arts experience (a few years of karate, and a year of thai boxing) from many years ago. I’m starting this group in the hopes of gathering a few friendly people with varying skill levels to teach and motivate each other. To test our skills and their effectiveness. When the weather is fine, we meet in Central Park just off Central Park West and 87th Street; in the colder months, we meet at studio spaces, and locations are announced one or two days prior to each session. Join us!*

*PLEASE NOTE: This is a fun and friendly training environment. However, given the intense physical nature of our activities, injuries will occur from time to time. THE ORGANIZERS OF THIS GROUP ARE IN NO WAY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY INJURIES THAT MIGHT OCCUR.

*RULES OF ENGAGEMENT* When sparring we adhere to the common 50%, 2/3rds strength when sparring that is common practice in many dojos and camps. If you wish to engage hard, communicate with your partner beforehand so you both are on the same page. We are here to test each other and test ourselves, learn from each other and ultimately learn about ourselves. Strength is not just how hard you can punch, but having discipline and control as well. Kob kun krab!
results.name: Manhattan Muay Thai

results.description:
Public transit has the potential to be awesome, moving us around our city quickly and easily. But sometimes it really sucks. Buses are never on time, routes can be unfamiliar, and connections are difficult. On the other hand, taxis are too expensive, hard to find and there is no easy way to share a ride with other users.

The latest evolutions in transportation provide enough data to plan and develop new mobile apps, where no operative intervention of dispatchers (or other external agents) is required. Local companies such as Uber, Lyft or Sidecar (among other ride and car sharing, and taxi apps -Hailo, TaxiMagic, Flywheel, Blablacar, MyTaxi) are opening a window into a new relationship between cars and passengers, bringing a closer and more immediate response to a much more personalized transportation.

Let's work together to shape the future of urban mobility and use data/technology/design to make it real.

I'd like to build a community of transit nerds, developers and designers to contribute to the future of urban transportation and take it new directions so it can serve more riders in new and unexpected ways. I can't do it alone, so together let's drag public transit, paratransit and taxicab into the 21st century.
results.name: Future of Urban Transportation - NY

results.description:
Dharma Voices for Animals (DVA) is an organization of those committed both to practicing the teachings of the Buddha (the Dharma) and to speaking out when animal suffering is supported by the actions of those in Dharma communities and by the policies of Dharma centers. We want to be the voice of the animals who cannot speak our language and are unable to ask, “Why are you paying people to do this to me?” or “Why are you supporting my suffering?” We want to support those who are willing to speak out about the harm we cause other sentient beings when we eat them, use their body parts as clothing and in other ways, or use household and personal hygiene products that are tested on animals. While DVA recognizes the challenges of living in a complex, modern society, we wish to promote the choices that provide the greatest reduction of animal suffering. It is our intention to be inclusive in honoring the different views of those who sincerely intend to minimize the suffering of animals.

You are welcome to attend a variety of events when you join the DVA New York Chapter meetup.  In addition to this group we invite you to support our efforts by visiting the website:

http://dharmavoicesforanimals.org/

May all living beings be happy and free!


Our Leadership Team:

Bob Isaacson is the President of Dharma Voices for Animals.  He has practiced the Dharma for nineteen years in the Vipassana/Theravada tradition, and taught numerous classes and retreats.   Bob is also a former human rights and civil rights attorney.  He enjoys hiking, biking, swimming, and world travel.

Kamil Ghoshal is the DVA New York Chapter Leader and dedicated Eight-Precept (aṭṭha-sīla) Theravādin disciple (upāsaka) at the Original Buddhism Society.  He is an aspiring Buddhist scholar with background in Western Philosophy.  Kamil's mission outside of DVA is to help restore the original presectarian Teachings of the historical Buddha, Siddhāttha Gotama.  He is also a mountaineer and traditional Chinese kung-fu practitioner.
results.name: Dharma Voices for Animals - New York Chapter

results.description:
This group is here to connect you to other tennis players that play on a similar skill level and live close enough to get a match in, even with your busy schedule.

This is not a group for finding personal lessons or instructors, it's a group for people that are looking for a good singles or doubles match up. How this works:

1. Create or Join a Meetup: Specify if looking for doubles/singles and your skill level (see below)
2. Once you have enough people for a game, coordinate with them on time, location, and court reservations 

Your next move: Use the message board and meetup schedule to find match-ups near you!

Need your help: Please message me if you want to be able to post Meetups, and I can grant you that access.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Skill Levels:


1.0: This player is Just starting to play tennis.

1.5: Has limited experience and is still working primarily on getting the ball into play.

2.0: Has obvious stroke weaknesses but is familiar with basic positions for singles and doubles play.

2.5: Can sustain a short rally of slow pace with other players of the same ability.

3.0: Fairly consistent when hitting medium-paced shots, but is not comfortable with all strokes and lacks execution when trying for directional control, depth or power.

3.5: Has achieved improved stroke dependability with directional control on moderate shots, but still lacks depth and variety. Starting to exhibit more aggressive net play.

4.0: Has dependable strokes, including directional control and depth on both forehand and backhand sides on moderate shots, plus the ability to use lobs, overheads, approach shots and volleys with some success.

4.5: Starting to master the use of power and spins and beginning to handle pace, has sound footwork, can control depth of shots and is beginning to vary game plan according to opponents.

5.0: Has good shot anticipation and frequently has an outstanding shot or exceptional consistency around which a game may be structured.

5.5: Can vary strategies and styles of play in a competitive situation and hit dependable shots in a stress situation.

6.0: has obtained a sectional and /or national ranking.

6.5: has extensive satellite tournament experience.

7.0: makes his living from tournament prize money.


-----------------------------------------------------------------
New York City Courts:

Central Park: Central Park 93d St. near West Drive

Brian Watkins Tennis Center: East River Park, At Houston St. (walk east over FDR Drive)

Washington Market Park: Chambers St. & West St.

Hudson River Park: Near W 10th St on the Hudson River
results.name: NYC Tennis Match-up

topics.name: Studying for the Graduate Record Exam

results.description:
Do you need to refresh your math for college algebra, the GRE, the GMAT, or just for work and life? Are you going back to school after years in the working world?

I'm here to help! This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes some of the following topics:

Algebra
Word Problems
Elementary Number Theory (Odds, Evens, Primes)
Probability
Geometry
Fractions, Decimals, Repeating Decimals
Percents and Compound Interest This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup groups, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura and Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am author, co-author, or editor of many test prep books covering math, vocabulary, grammar, logic, and more. I have developed a series of seminars on "Intellectual Performance Enhancement," covering topics from test stress to the inferential logic common to both verbal reasoning and math problems. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a 780 on the GMAT (including perfect 51Q). More importantly, I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly (especially to people who have "math terror"), and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: College Algebra / High School Math Refresher with Jen Dziura
