results.description:
"NETWORKING is the single most powerful marketing tactic to accelerate and sustain success for any individual or organization!" – Adam Small 

Why do I need to network?

1. As entrepreneurs and professionals, it is imperative that we stay around like minded individuals. Relationships are the catalyst for success. 

2. In this ever so growing competitive job market, you will quickly learn that it is not always what you know, but who do you know.

3. You never know what personal connection or business deal is hidden in a little conversation. 

4. If you are seasoned, you can meet a young pup with a lot of pep to do heavy lifting for you.

5. If you are new, you can meet an expert in your field and skip a lot of mistakes just by listening to their experiences. 

What makes us different?

1.Here at the NJ Networking Circle we like to keep things fun and innovative, even for the shy and timid. What better way is there to wind down a hard work week then with a little professional party and networking. We like to consider ourselves the transition group because we are not in an up tight work atmosphere, nor is it a full blown out night at the club. You can consider it to be either the cool down of a long week or the warm up to a great weekend; the choice is yours. We just want you to take a load off and have a great time meeting great people. 

2.We will give small trainings on how to network as well as business tips.

3.Guest speakers will be booked. Usually local entrepreneurs and professionals who have success and can offer useful advice. 

4. We encourage members to make long lasting connection by helping them to find accountability partners. These are the people that will keep us on track and hold us accountable for the goals that we set.
results.name: NJ Entrepreneur and Professional Networking Circle

results.description:
A small group of geologists, earth science teachers, students and hobbyists organized the SIGS in 1972 to stimulate interest in mineralogy, geology, paleontology, and the lapidary arts.  The Society has broad activities designed for everyone from beginners to professionals. These activities include illustrated presentations on a wide range of earth science topics, participation in gem and mineral shows and field trips to available collecting areas, both here and in other states. The informal social environment of the Society holds the interest of all ages from the youngest to the oldest. The general meetings are free and open to all who wish to attend. We are also affiliated with the Eastern Federation of Mineralogical and Lapidary Societies (EFMLS) and the American Federation of Mineralogical Societies (AFMS). Meetings are held on the second Friday of the month (September to June) at 7:30 P.M. in the basement meeting room of the Father Hicks Center, St. Clare's School, Lindenwood Road entrance, Great Kills, Staten Island. At each meeting, a speaker presents a talk on their specialized field. Some are skilled hobbyists and others well-known professionals, but all of them bring their specialties to us for our enjoyment.

In order to participate in SIGS field trips, you must be a member in good standing, as our liability insurance will cover you not only to and from the field trips but to and from our meetings on Staten Island, New York as well.
results.name: Staten Island Geological Society Inc.

topics.name: "Cloud Computing" How to use it for your business

results.description:
Today's corporate officers and IT technologists are literally deluged with marketing hype over cloud, and the economic advantages of migrating business and IT functions and applications to the cloud. 
• We have seen corporate giants like NetFlix and Sabre (global reservation system used by major airline carriers) experience cloud-based system outages, causing customer delays and significantly impacting business not just in the US, but impacted globally in the case of Sabre.
• There are hundreds of cloud providers to choose from in the market today. Not all are enterprise ready, despite their claims. And let's face it, many have paid or biased positioning in leading independent studies released by highly respected IT research companies. 
• How does a CIO or CTO, and today's CEO, tasked to identify the essential drivers of a business, navigate? Leading independent think tanks (Gartner, Aberdeen, IDC, etc) are not fully equipped to provide battle-tested and deep thorough analysis regarding the critical issues of cloud security, network throughput, reliability and ROI when it comes to enterprise grade customers. Researchers can only convey what they read and disseminate their opinions, not facts. Gartner even has in its disclaimer that all analysis is "opinion and not based on facts." 
• It's time that we get real answers and share actual experiences from companies who are using enterprise grade cloud and from true technologists that has the experience and credentials to provide an unbiased roadmap. 
• GOAL: We create leaner, more efficient companies that is secure, reliable and has the ROI to start training our current employees, and bringing jobs back to the US workforce.
results.name: New York Cloud Computing Meetup

Our group includes students, senior citizens, ministers, professionals, retirees, any gender or religious affiliation; people with speech impediments & accents, the disabled; tenured Toastmasters and first-timers - we are an eclectic group. results.description: This group is about meeting up with other adults with disabilities, socializing, and forming relationships. I was born with Cerebral Palsy and know how hard it is to date. Society judges us by our appearance or how "normal" we look. Everyone wants someone to love. Everyone can use a friend. I hope this group helps myself and many others meet someone special (male or female). It would be great to gather and go to the movies, bowling, parks, and restaurants. I have another meetup group as well that's more for non-dating, but at the end of the day, I am just trying to get the word out about this group ! Join either one, or both !! Just join !! Let's meetup ! Let's laugh! :)
results.name: Dating for the Disabled

results.description:
We, the organizers of the New York Asian writers Meetup have noticed that many of the language exchange and assistance programs in New York catering to Asians have been based in Manhattan despite that many of the attendees hail from Queens. In addition, we have noticed that most of the language assistance content has been focused on oral communication and reading of non-fiction/short articles in English.

 The organizers of this new meetup hope to bring back the meetings to the local community: Queens. In addition to English speaking and language and cultural exchange, we will also be focusing on writing--both academic and creative (pros/poetry) as well as reading fiction, non-fiction, short essays, articles, excerpts from books, and poems every two weeks. Hopefully, the readings will spark discussion about themes, concepts, ideas and issues relevant the Asia diaspora; Asian American; Pacific Islander and immigrant experience.

 Our target audience is those of Asian descent in NY (Manhattan, Queens, LI, Brooklyn, Staten Island, Bronx, and Queens). Book lovers, writers, and students are encouraged to join our meetings. Whether you are a novice writer, who needs feedback, criticism, or even proof-reading; or an accomplished writer, who would like to see how your writing will be accepted by the public and how people will be impacted by your writing; or a student working on a research paper for school; in all cases, we encourage you to submit your writing and join our meet-up group. Hopefully, these original pieces will also stimulate discussion relevant to diverse Asian communities in NY and the immigrant and international experience that is NYC.

All sorts of writing are encouraged: short stories, poems, articles or essays. There will also be opportunities for peer-to-peer proofreading and also sharing your original writings with the group. There also maybe workshops on how to advance your research skills using our American library system.

 And, finally, we hope to include events and activities that will allow our members to explore the city and get to know each other better. Events such as book readings and signings, dinners, or events at the Asian American Writers Workshop, or visits to interesting but obscure used bookstores, will be included. Our Meetups will be in warm environments like city parks or cafes in Queens. Since we are new, we may change the format as we cater to the ever changing needs of our members.

Important:

 When submitting request to join please upload a real picture of yourself - otherwise your membership will be rejected. Please join us!
results.name: New York English Language Exchange & Asian Writers Meetup

results.description:
About the Trillium Path

Consciousness

The Trillium path stems from the principles of Waking Down in Mutuality, and includes the investigation and realization of infinite Consciousness as your fundamental identity and core essence. Discovering you are free of limits, while also being in touch with them, helps pave the way for the second birth awakening where you recognize the underlying unity of Consciousness and matter. To activate this realization, our teachers offer transmission by non-verbally conveying the awakened condition from one individual to another. Transmission rapidly catalyzes your awakening, and is readily available via gazing meditation, writings, recordings, personal sessions, small group sittings or large group events. As a practitioner, you might notice shifts impacting many areas of your life in a short period of time. Within a few months to a few years, you’ll most likely achieve your second birth, and be deeply engaged in embodying that awareness throughout your life.

Embodiment

The Trillium journey helps you discover you are simultaneously infinite and finite. The embodiment dimension of our work helps you embrace infinite Consciousness throughout the full range of your unique human form, from its messy, uncomfortable aspects to its most delightful qualities. We use greenlighting, a form of profound compassion and radical acceptance, to become aware of whatever we are experiencing so that we can integrate it, and allow it to be organically transformed over time. Greenlighting relaxes the body-mind and enlivens the body’s experience of infinite Consciousness. Facing patterns and revisiting past wounds is a natural part of the awakening process. It frees energy and attention for greater levels of aliveness in the present. For support throughout the process, we recommend you turn to your teachers, mentors, and peers. Support teams can also include licensed therapists as well as other practitioners within and outside the Trillium Awakening community.

Mutuality

Mutual, conscious relating is essential to the Trillium journey. Mutuality is a relationship disposition that self and other are two aspects of singular Being. In other words, other is not really “other”; it is also you, and it is therefore impossible to harm another person without also harming yourself. Living this aspect of relatedness means having profound respect for others, listening deeply, and reflecting consciously. It also means honoring and speaking your truth while making room for others to do the same—which can be challenging. Through the practice of mutuality, you deeply explore and claim your authentic nature though vulnerable self-expression, even when it is uncomfortable. You also build capacity to perceive the tension and experience the discomfort in your differences with others. Old wounds might surface when engaging in mutuality, but, over time, the practice builds trust and facilitates deep healing and transformation. While honoring each other’s truth and existential equality in Being, mutuality simultaneously evokes respect for the functional hierarchy within our community.


This meet up is for the spiritually minded who feel drawn to an earthy-bodily connection to being alive and presence as their lives.

For those who are not satisfied with soaring spirituality as enjoying as that can be but only temporary but long for an embodied heart-ful connection to themselves and others. We meet in meditation and contemplate our already whole-being lives. 

 The alchemical charge and transformational field that gets activated when we come together completely without an agenda, just for the sake of itself, is moving and inspiring. Please join us.


This group is facilitated by Bill Miller, visit his personal website:

http://www.heart-awakening.com/


Bill is a formal member in the Trillium Awakening Teachers Circle TATC

http://teachers.trilliumawakening.org/BillMiller/

http://www.trilliumawakening.org/
results.name: Trillium Awakening. 21st Century Spirituality. North Jersey

results.description:
The GIFTS (GLBTQ in Fellowship, Tradition and Service) Fellowship is a LGBTQ community of faith, a vital part of Marble Collegiate Church. GIFTS works to co-create with God, a world in which people of all sexual orientations and gender identities are embraced as God’s beloved children, a world in which each of us know ourselves to be created in God’s image, gifted and unique. Marble Collegiate Church has been welcoming and affirming of LGBTQ people since 1992, when a small group of gay men who were a part of the Marble community formed GIFTS. We hope you will join us in creating this world through one of our programs and activities!

Marble Collegiate Church is a diverse, inclusive community of God’s people whose faith is led by the life and teachings of Jesus Christ. We welcome, love and empower all persons to become positive thinkers, filled with hope, making a difference in the world. Marble Church is a welcoming and affirming congregation, and worships in the tradition of the Reformed Church in America (formerly Dutch Reformed). 

For more information about the GIFTS Fellowship, its programs and events, or Marble Collegiate Church, please visit us at www.MarbleChurch.org, email us at GIFTS@MarbleChurch.org or call us at 212.686.2770 x260.

Find us on Facebook!
results.name: Marble Church LGBTQ Christian Meetup

Imagine a group of engineers who work with the same technologies and have an interest in shaping its future. A W3C of its own, in one house, drafting up specs for ES7. It's time to have fun, change the game, and most importantly: to not be alone in a City fixated on models, jocks, actors, and douchepackers. This is that core circle of friends you've been looking for; the ones who get you, who co-habitat your Matrix-like experience of reality, who support you and want to grow with you. That's Pi Omicron Pi, the fraternity for nerds. Are you interested?

We also look forward to host joint events with many of the multitude of great tech groups based in New York City and beyond.

results.description:
This is about getting the best Russian spa / sauna treatments in a group of fun people. We plan to have Aromatherapy, Platza (traditional leaves massage) treatment and a lesson, salt scrub, honey mask and more.

If you are a veteran banya-goer who knows how to enjoy steam room and saunas or just want a little adventure trying something uniquely Russian right here in the heart of the city, join us for this experience. Russian baths are tricky to explore on your own (venik technique anyone?) and are best to be done in the mix of experts and neophytes. Lets meet together in one of the Russian baths, learn from each other and enjoy all the banyas have to offer.

Baths events are often associated with gay hookups. While nothing against it in general, don't get confused, this is NOT such an event.
results.name: NYC Russian Baths (Banya) sauna meetup

results.description:
Want to lean more about photography from fun, friendly, and professional photography instructors? Want to meet new people, take great photos, and have a ton of fun at the same time? New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops is the group for you!

Our fun and friendly photography group offers classes for all levels of photographers - from the novice who just bought their first camera and can't find the power button, to the seasoned pro who wants to hone their skills and meet new people.   

All of our classes are organized by Remember Forever Photography and include professional instruction from our veteran photographers, and a free course workbook with notes and lessons from class. Best of all, when you sign up through Meetup, all of our classes are half off the retail price!

So grab your camera and bring some friends for a fun and memorable photo experience! We have 5 star reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor and Travelzoo! Check out our website as well at www.rememberforever.co

Frequently Asked Questions

1.  Help! I can't find my instructor/don't know where we're meeting!

After you sign up for one of our Meetups, you should shortly receive an email from Remember Forever Photography with directions to your meeting spot and contact information for your instructor for the day.  If you don't receive an email from us, give our business office a call at 646.736.3231 and we'll be happy to put you in touch with your instructor, or send you another copy of your confirmation email. Most of our instructors also have the Meetup.com app, so you can send them a direct message as well if you need to.


2. Can I just pay you in cash when I get to class?

Unfortunately, we can't accept cash for tax purposes. Sorry! Most of our instructors can process credit cards on site, but we really appreciate it if you sign up through Meetup first so we get an accurate headcount on who's coming to class.


3. What do I do if it's raining/snowing/hurricaning on the day of my Meetup?

We'll notify everyone by email as soon as possible if we feel we need to cancel a Meetup due to the weather.  If we do need to cancel, we'll automatically reschedule you to the next available Meetup or any Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value.  Check out each individual Meetup for for more info on our refund policy. 


4. Why do you need at least two students enrolled to run a Meetup? And what happens if we don't get enough students signed up. 

Having at least two students per Meetup ensures that we cover the cost of liability insurance for our students and also ensures we can pay our awesome staff photographers a fair wage. 

If we don't have enough students to run a Meetup, we'll notify you as soon as possible and get you signed up for the next available Meetup, or any other Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value. 


5.  I don't see any other students signed up.  Does this mean my Meetup is canceled?

Maybe not! We get students signing up for our courses from several sources in addition to our Meetup group. Unless we notify you otherwise, we more than likely have enough students enrolled to run as scheduled.


Still have questions? Feel free to give us a call at 646.736.3231 or drop us an email at info@rememberforever.co
results.name: New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops

results.description:
Welcome!

The purpose of this meetup is to convene all sorts of folks that design experiences for people—from architects, to urban designers, to product designers, to web/app designers, to service designers, and more. If you create experiences for people—be they physical or digital—this meetup group is for you.

As we gain members, the activities of this group may shift to suit our needs, but my initial plans for meetups are as follows:

• panel discussions/presentations

• skill/method workshops

• networking events

• mini projects/"hackathons" (think 2 hours)


Please reach out if you have specific ideas for what you'd like to get out of this group. Thanks!

results.description:
What we do?

At Adventure Nuts we seek to change your world one adventure at a time through play and mutual learning. Together we are a tribe of passionate, knowledgeable and driven individuals who aim to inspire and support one another to develop both personally and professionally.

Why we do it?

At Adventure Nuts we believe in four core values: Learn. Share. Play. Inspire

Learn. We are all students in the life long process of learning. We ask questions to gain knowledge from one another, in order to help us better understand the world around us.

Share. As part of a tribe we contribute our expertise and engage in open conversations. Through mutual and shared respect we build the foundation of a trusting community.

Play. We let loose and embrace the unknown to enter the world of fun and play. Adult responsibilities aside, we live in the present moment.

Inspire. We are all unique and passionate adventure seekers. It is our differences that motivate and encourage us to be bold, take risks and try something new.
results.name: Adventure Nuts

results.description:
This group is about photographers and models who are from all levels of experience, who are looking to collaborate together to produce some fantastic images.  We are now expanded to MUA's and fashion designers, and hair stylists to make the creative experience a more rewarding one.  Our group will meet once to twice a month; I also run another meet-up group and want to dedicate enough time to both groups.  

The idea is our model members will participate for themed shoots; have their makeup done by our MUA's  while our photographer members will photograph them.  All parties will learn from one another, resulting in some fun diversified images.  We will try our best to match the number of photographers to each model and every model will have the opportunity to get photographed.  Our activities will be non-paying for all sides, but the experience is very rewarding.

[In cases where we do not have model members to model for us, we will have the option of recruiting outside models, which may require $20 per person.  I will do my best to keep that cost as low as possible.]

• Please post your images in a prompt manner and forward a minimum of 6 images so that our model members, and Makeup artists could keep or add to their portfolios. Photographers have one week from the date of our event to edit and process their pics to be forwarded to each model and makeup artist.  Unless otherwise specified by the Organizers, (Failure to do so, means that you aren't in compliance to our group rules which isn't fair to our models or MUA's and interferes with our exchange.  As a result you will be asked to leave our group, serious artists are required here.). 

I recommend placing watermarks on all your creative works.  Release forms will be given out to protect the creative works of the photographer and to ensure 6 images for our models and MUA's. (NO OUTSIDE RELEASE FORMS ALLOWED!!!!)

I welcome ideas for great convenient locations where we can take our photographs.   Together we can build up our portfolio's for creative growth and new possibilities.  Our past events have topped by the next, and keeping this momentum requires serious artists, and creativity. 

Disclaimer: be mindful of the risks of the weather and travels, all participation is at your own risk.   It is your responsibility to stay up to date with travel changes or delays.  But when I can I will post necessary info. as they become available. 

Our newest feature: we have a google plus community

https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/102...

All members should to make your membership experience even better.  During off season months we continue to stay connected on our page where we share, learn, ask questions and much more.  You enter as a stranger but continue on as friends, welcome all.
results.name: New York Photo Exchange

results.description:
We currently focus on the Android platform, but we're always open to other Google technologies please join our group and consider hosting a session. 

To visit this page directly just visit GDGNJ.org

Our meetings will always be free and open to the general public. These events will be hosted in the Newark area.

Disclaimer: GDG New Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. What is a GDG (As defined by Google)? Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, App Engine, and Google Chrome platforms, to product APIs like the Maps API,YouTube API and Google Calendar API. A GDG can take many forms -- from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers.

results.description:
Q:   Do you like to stay well-informed on the current events, and enjoy reading and discussing various topics for intellectual stimulation?

A:   Well, you've come to the right place!

The premise is simple: We get together each month and discuss something interesting based on what the members find compelling in a news article, video segment, or audio program.  The topics can range from the serious to the inane, but we strive to discuss something that has enriching coverage and deep analysis.  Click here to see a sample of our favorite, but non-exhaustive sources.

Our goal is to provide a friendly forum for people to come in person, sit down at a table for about two hours, and exchange views and discuss ideas over coffee or whatever beverage of their own choosing.  The organizers will keep the discussions open and moving. 

We try to keep meetup sizes relatively small to allow participation and interaction, keeping in mind what the venue will allow. Members can sign up for the waitlist if all the spots fill up. As people with RSVPs cancel, waitlisted members will be moved onto the RSVP list. Organizers will try to reasonably accommodate longstanding members who've had good past attendance as well as members who contribute by the way of an article suggestion or thoughtful comment.

How it works: Each meeting organizers select a theme and an article to go along with it. Members nominate and vote on a second article. Attending members of a meeting are expected to come prepared for discussion by having read both articles.

To encourage members to arrive early so meetings can end on time, we offer a pre-meeting topic. Usually a lighter discussion based on more immediate events. There may be an article attached, but reading of it is not required.

Join us, as we share thoughtful discussions on the topics that interest everyone!
results.name: Café News

Our group intends on hosting quality, organized, affordable events that will allow you to meet new people, try something different... and have fun while doing it! We are meeting in the NYC Area. In the end, it's not going to matter how many breaths you took, but how many moments took your breath away. So join Us and lets have some FUN! Hopefully see you soon,

Thanks, Robert

results.description:
This is a group for Progressive Muslims in their 20's or 30's looking to meet each other in NY, have light friendly conversation, socializing and connecting. We plan to meet at different venues in NYC, eat out, picnics,day trips, night outs and other adventures. We want to create a meet up for young, active and modern Muslims whether singles, couples or young families who enjoy brunching, dining, sports, outdoor adventures and some nightlife. This is not a religious,social or political discussion group. In fact we will steer clear from such topics and enjoy good company. Non Muslims who fit this profile are welcome to join us as well.  Membership is open to residents of NY, NJ and CT.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending which is only fair considering there is no membership fee for this group and we do not charge event fees either.

All events are members only, guests are no longer allowed.

Please link the meet up group to an active email ID so emails and messages reach you in timely manner. This group is for ACTIVE members only. INACTIVE members will be removed from group and are welcome to re-join when they are able to participate more actively. ACTIVE members are requested to make an effort to participate in any one event at least 3 months from their date of joining and 6 months from their last event to retain their membership. Our efforts are to create a compact, dynamic group and you should have the time and inclination to attend events. 

 Actual photo must be included in your profile, membership will be declined if anything else is displayed. 

Meetup messaging is an important communication tool for this group, please ensure you are able to access and respond to messages sent by organizers. To access and reply to your messages click on the dialogue icon in top right corner with desktop view of this site or on the dialogue icon at the bottom in the meetup app. We have formed some good friendships in this group. If you want to connect with other members please join us for events. Inappropriate messages and behavior will not be tolerated and such members will be removed from group.

Organizing takes lot of time and effort and therefore we place high premium on members attending events as RSVP'd. Our organizers are offering to organize/host events in their spare time and are equally busy in their lives/careers, so we want to make this a smooth process for everyone. Request all members to note below rules of the group and take a moment before you RSVP. Treat these events as other social events where you are a guest and extend courtesy to the host/event organizer by RSVP'ing carefully. Thank you.

No need to RSVP NO if you are not attending, unless you are changing your RSVP from YES to NO.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending. RSVP's will be considered FINAL 48 hrs prior to the event, last minute change allowed in certain unavoidable circumstances. Remember that waitlisted members deserve fair opportunity to attend.

Certain premium reserved events as indicated on the event write up will only have Final RSVP, in other words it will be considered no show if you change from YES to NO. 

No shows (members who RSVP YES and do not show up for the event without notice) will be removed from the group and banned from re-joining.

RSVP changes on day of event will not be tolerated with some understandable and reasonable exceptions.

Habitual RSVP changers (members who repeatedly RSVP Yes and change to NO) will be moved to waitlist by default. They may also be charged a meetup fee in advance for attending future events.

Please try to arrive on time for events and use MTA trip planner tool which is useful if you are using public transit for directions, transit changes during weekend and timings.

http://tripplanner.mta.info/mobile/

Feel free to contact with any suggestions for events that you may like to attend or host.

This group is dedicated to helping the solo/small business owner develop his market, brand, communication, etc. 

Have you read a book, taken a class, seen a coach, followed their advice and come up with something that seems great, but there is no way to get feedback without spending a ton of money for more coaching, more classes, etc. that you can't afford?

It happened to me a while back.  I took a great course, but the promised support and feedback wasn't there, and to get feedback and the great ideas I came up with, would have cost me hundreds or thousands of dollars.  Instead of spending all that money, I thought, I could find a group of smart people who could help each other.

If you are interested in getting some feedback for your great ideas?  If you are looking for resources and recommendations?  Join us!

results.description:
Welcome!

Converged Infrastructure New York City group (CINYC) is a forum for gaining awareness and exchanging ideas around practical benefits of convergence of business and technology.  Each one of us is, in some way, focused on bridging the gap between business requirements and the properly structured set of technologies to address such requirements.   We are sensitive to the dichotomy that often exists between various groups in large organizations and we are passionate about taking a collaborative approach to closing such gaps.  We are here to learn, to help each other recognize and reap rewards promised by convergence of infrastructure - a relatively new trend focused on lowering the cost of operating cloud environments by engineering and packaging technology stacks.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Converged_infrastructure

We exist to help facilitate meetups where professionals & end-users can share best practices for valuing, deploying and operating CI technologies.  Professionals and experts can become aware of new market needs, and new users can gain practical knowledge, expand their foundations about market trends; everyone can grow their professional network. The collaborative cross-organizational approach to implementing CI and harnessing its benefits encourages sharing of ideas, giving rise to sharing best practices - for everyone’s benefit.

Join us if your areas of interest include business transformation, DevOps, use-cases, lessons learned as part of improved organizational re-alignment, as well as intersections of economics and technology.   We expect to have a good mix of technical and business topics and, naturally, welcome speakers and practitioners.
results.name: Converged Infrastructure NYC

results.description:
Circling is the art of presence and co-discovering our deepest selves in community with each other “in the moment”.

 It’s a practice that allows you to enliven, deepen and richen conversations into experiences of profound empathy and insight. 

It’s a practice that naturally has you building skills in connecting, communication, conflict resolution and understanding others. 

It’s a practice that supports the development of genuine curiosity and appreciation for yourself and others. 

What it looks like is a group of people in a circle with their open, curious attention on one individual “getting circled”. Their intention is to “be with” and “understand” what’s happening for this individual moment by moment as “whatever is happening arises”.

The results, in my experience, are profound visceral connection and a quality of conversation that has people moved, inspired and nourished. In my experience, it also results in a much greater awareness of oneself and others. 

This is a meetup group for those interested in developing skills around or experiencing any of what they read above. 

Members can expect to learn the basics of Circling and to participate in two circles every meet up.
results.name: New York Circling Meetup Group

results.description:
An Ethics Lab is a discussion and support group that meets weekly on Wednesdays at Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. We are a separate entity and nobody has to join anything to work with us.

We sit around a big wooden table and we talk about what we want to change about ourselves and what we have to do to make that happen. New habits we want to cultivate. Old habits we want to let go of. Beliefs or reactions we have that are harmful to us and other people. Sometimes we discuss ethics or science or religion.

We decide on goals for ourselves and go to the Ethics Lab to report and for support.

Examples:

Mindfulness meditations. Losing weight. Finding a correct lay monastery to join. Developing your critical faculties by use of formal logic and/or mathematics. Overcoming addictions including addictions to emotions or ideas. Gaining weight. Expressing yourself through artwork. Prayer. Joining a group so you can trick yourself into reinventing yourself. Yoga. Finding a boyfriend or girlfriend. Jogging. Changing careers.

Someone pointed out that we are keeping the art of conversation alive. Yep. With a bit of Socratic method, performance art and good old fashioned magic smoke & mirrors mixed in.

Three examples of the kind of thing I might recommend to someone during a talk at the Ethics Lab.

1. Decide on the thing you want to change in yourself and then only commit to observing yourself as it is happening as the very first step.

2. Taking the time to find out what your thoughts and feelings are about your thoughts and feelings.

3. Understanding that meditating can be whatever you are doing at the moment.

An Ethics Lab is a place where people with different even opposing beliefs meet and learn that we are of value to each other because of those differences. It’s a lab because we see being wrong as an opportunity to learn.

I enjoy witnessing people deciding to change then doing it. I also enjoy telling their stories. I’m a writer so I see the Ethics Lab as a mix of everything from poetry to journalism.

I’ve learned so much from the folks who have sat at the table with me since September of last year. Every account of conscious change I can pass on makes it easier for someone, somewhere.
results.name: Ethics Lab of Brooklyn

If you are an adult sibling of a person with autism who cares and worries about their families, join us! There is strength and support in numbers and you just might enjoy swaaping stories and solutions!

results.description:
NY novelist Arthur Nersesian  is a prolific novelist with more than  ten novels written in the  last fifteen years.  He is offering for the first time an intensive six week workshop in which he will critique each member's work and share with them the secrets of his successful writing career.  The class will meet once a week and be limited to seven writers who have a work in progress and are serious about getting their work published.

In addition to the workshop, Arthur will give talks based on his own personal experiences regarding:

*Conceiving and plotting a work

*Revising a work upon completion, making it sharper, crisper and better

*The daily discipline of writing (and overcoming blocks)

*How to get your work published, some basic business tips

Anyone interested should submit a fiction writing sample of no more than 3000 words (10 pages) in length. Although his expertise is in the novel form, he will consider short stories, screenplays, and plays. Arthur will then conduct an interview with the most qualified candidates. Payment must be made in advance. Only seven seats are available. Feel free to contact Arthur with any questions.

More about the Author:
Arthur has been published by HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster and Akashic Books. Four of his full-length plays were produced Off-off Broadway, and are now published together as East Village Tetralogy. He wrote the screenplay for one of his books, and last year his third book, Dogrun, was made into a major motion picture, directed by Anthony Edwards, and starring Heather Graham and Gina Gershon. His books have been translated into a half a dozen languages. His short stories, essays, poems and reviews have appeared in various books, magazines and journals.

This is an amazing opportunity to learn in an intimate setting the ins and outs of how to get your work published from someone who has actually done it.
results.name: Intensive Writer Workshop with Real NY Novelist

results.description:
Yes, there is canyoneering in the Northeast!  Come join us if you're interested. 

I'm hoping this meetup will help bring together canyoneers across the region and help bring the sport to the Northeast.

-Andre

What's a typical trip like? A typical trip involves hiking/bushwhacking to the top of a water course and following it down by rappelling waterfalls (some over 100'), down-climbing, lots of slippery boulder hopping, and bushwhacking. Swims are possible, deep wading probably, and there's always lots of getting splashed on.

NEC is not a guide or training service. All trips are member organized and you are solely responsible for your own safety.  

All participants must be, at minimum:

• Strong hikers able to navigate off-trail and bushwhack across difficult terrain (scree, unstable slopes, slippery stream beds, boulder fields, etc) with heavy ropes and gear.

• Experienced rappellers able to negotiate challenging rappels with overhangs, loose rocks, water, slippery footing, etc. Having rappelled once or twice is not "experienced".

• Knowledgeable enough to safety check anchors, rigging, knots and each other. 

What about less experienced members?

You can join the meetup, but cannot come on trip without proper training.

NEC is not a guiding or instructional service and does not provide training, but there are a few other options:

1) The best way to get started is to take a 3 day course from a professional instructor in the Zion, Moab, or Los Angeles areas.  Unfortunately there are no instructors on the East Coast. 

2) The second best way is to learn rappelling and anchor building from another sport (like technical caving, ice climbing, mountaineering, and rock climbing). Canyoneering techniques are a little different but the foundation skills are enough to join our trips. 

In time there will an online resource section to supplement formal training with canyoneering-specific techniques and some informal members-hosted skill building practice sessions.
results.name: Northeast Canyoneering

results.description:
Feminism, ah--a word that carries so much baggage. Let's unearth it. Let's talk street harassment. Let's talk gender. Let's talk theory. Let's talk empowerment. Let's talk love. 

People of all sexes and genders and nonsexes and nongenders from Brooklyn and beyond are welcome.

What is woman?
Are there things about her that escape the conditioned influences of her character?
How do capitalism and patriarchy make sense of this creature?
Is there freedom for woman in patriarchy?
What is the aim of the street harasser and how can we subvert them?
How can we react to oppression--let alone spot it, declare it for what it is?
How can we recognize the oppressor within ourselves?
How is feminism too often racialized?
Hell, what does that word even mean?

Welcome to The Feminist Salon!
results.name: The Feminist Salon

results.description:
Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies.

Is going into business for you?

If so, enjoy meeting new contacts for networking and be part of the group that brings together a broad range of people thinking about starting a new business. Members include start-up entrepreneurs, experts sharing their knowledge and investors looking for new concepts.

We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars.

This group is intended to be an educational think tank that will help you with the elements of conceiving and starting a new business. Our purpose is to support each other in learning, growing and having fun along the way.

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know! 

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

Organizer: Roger Kuperways, Ph.D. Life long Entrepreneur, investor, and former adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at New York University. 

See us on Facebook and on our parent website http://www.businessonashoestring.com

Comments from past events:

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet" - Julia Meyer

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa

Through this group, we'll organize awesome events that will connect you with other driven professionals and help you expand your network. Looking forward to meeting you!
results.name: BOND Professional Networking

results.description:
We all have an instinctual need for human touch. In this chaotic, individualistic society we live in however, asking for help in fulfilling this most basic, most beautifully human desire has become taboo- a signal of weakness- especially among men. I started this group because I genuinely feel that so many of our ills and traumas could begin to be healed if we allowed ourselves to love and be loved in a completely unselfish, non-sexual way. I hope to host meetups at places like movie theatres, cafes and eventual members' homes, where we sit, hold each other, and talk about whatever might be on our minds. You will learn that it's okay to let other people in, and that it's okay to say no. You'll learn that you are enough and you are loved.
I encourage you, straight or gay, to give this a shot. I know this can change the world, if only we trust in the immense power of physical connection.
results.name: Cuddling Men NYC

We focus on sourcing quality ingredients, obtaining the best nutrition possible, and educating others on how to incorporate these fun and simple practices into their lives. Folks are always willing to lend a sympathetic ear.

We host a wide variety of events both for families and adults. Join us and come out for some events! You may find the camaraderie to be just what you're looking for.  The members are cool, the events are fun, the experiences are priceless.

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in discussing various topics on Japan and Korea over coffee. I started this group because both countries have equally fascinating people and cultures, yet few know well enough about both countries. We'll meet once a month to discuss various topics (in English) regarding two countries, ranging from foods and cultures to political relations and history. If there is enough interest, we can even invite local professors or professionals to learn in depth about our topic of interest regarding the two countries. Our goal is to build friendships and create values by learning different perspectives, not to argue who is right or wrong. This group is also not limited to Koreans and Japanese, but open to anyone who is interested in this topic. Feel free to swing by, meet friends, and share your thoughts!
results.name: Chat Over Coffee: Korea and Japan Friendships

results.description:
Tribute band shows are so much fun and often provide terrific live music experiences in small venues!  It's really amazing the level of dedication so many of these musicians put forth in perfecting not only the music, but the look, character, and personas of some of the most iconic and epic bands in history.   We are lucky to live in a spot with a wide variety of tribute acts which keep alive the legendary bands of the past.

Here we especially focus on classic rock tribute acts (Led Zeppelin, The Who, Rush, Pink Floyd, etc) but infuse other rock sub-genres: 80s new wave (The Smiths, The Cars, R.E.M.), 80s hard rock/arena rock/'hair band' (Guns N Roses, Def Leppard, Bon Jovi etc), and ‘softer’ rock (Billy Joel, Elton John, etc). There is ‘more' too with eclectic cover bands who frequently play in the area, such as The Nerds, The Mighty Spectrum, Back to the Garden 1969, The Ready Steady 60s, and The Ronald Reagans, just to name a few.

We are in need of event hosts, especially in NJ, NYC, and Long Island, so if anyone would like to be one and schedule an event, please let me know really soon!
results.name: Hudson Valley TRIBUTE BAND ROCKERS

results.description: Our club provides a forum and gathering place for amateur and professional photographers, at all levels of accomplishment. results.description:
yellowchair has partnered with some of the city's best restaurants, venues and chefs on innovative concepts that appeal to everyone from hardcore foodies to interesting conversationalists, all looking to meet like-minded people.

The core of yellowchair is its events business: Sandlofer and Goldstein create dinner concepts, match them with the best NYC venues and make seats available via their website,yellowchair.com. For a fixed price, people can access food and drinks that have been expertly curated by yellowchair and their partners, as well as meet like-minded people in a casual dinner setting. It's the perfect experience for food explorers, no-pressure dates and everything in between.

“yellowchair is the ultimate social network for people who love food – and people," says Goldstein.  “Our goal is to create a climate whereby members enrich their social experience with unique, themed food experiences.”

 “Think of it as an innovative version of dinner-with-friends - and new friends," Sandlofer adds. "You don't book a table just for your individual party.  You make a reservation and join other yellowchair members – thereby socializing with like-minded foodies, travelers, tastemakers – and enlarging your circle of acquaintances.”

Friends don't let friends sit in chairs that aren't yellow!

www.yellowchair.com
results.name: yellowchair.com Meetup

results.description:
Workout Details: 

Our workout focuses on functional movements. Some of the things we include are:

- Warmup

- Abs

- Lunges

- Burpees

- Squats 

- Pushups

- Sprints

- Partner Exercises 

- Dips

Bring a water bottle and your determination.

Our free workouts are created by certified fitness experts and are designed for everyone at any level of fitness.  

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you.

Note: When you RSVP we will send you a telephone number you can call/text in case you have any trouble finding us.


What people are saying:

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

Andie - #ThriveInThePark I never thought I would enjoy waking up early on a Saturday, but now I look forward to it, fun workouts with friends that keep you motivated to push yourself!

Dani - #ThriveInThePark I Love everything about it! Such a positive way to bring community together for some weekend activity. The guys/girls that lead the workout and stretches bring such great energy to the group, we basically laugh the whole time - until the lunges and burpees come along, no one laughs at those. 


About our Meetup:

Thrive in the Park was created by a group of friends with a common interest in fitness, clean food, and having a great time.

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

http://www.soRipe.com

History:

Thrive in the Park started in 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too will go out into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

results.description: Are you interested in becoming an effective public speaker and improving your listening skills? At $60 for six months it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Consider joining Harlem Toastmasters. The club is one of the 14,650 clubs of Toastmasters International. Toastmasters clubs operate in 126 countries. Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Members of Toastmasters improve their speaking skills by attending recurring meetings where they deliver speeches or evaluate other speakers. Membership in Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. How Does It Work? A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a no-pressure atmosphere. There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure.
results.name: Harlem Toastmasters Meetup

We will also have "Local Socials", where you can meet other like-minded people to travel with and find out more information about our trips planned. 

Looking forward to exploring the "THE WORLD" with everybody, together!

This is a group for anyone interested in traveling in groups small and large, who enjoy going to new places and meeting new people. All experience levels are welcome. I started this group for individuals looking to do more traveling.

results.description:
This is a group of people interested in viewing, collecting, discussing, learning and making Art Jewelry, Custom Jewelry, Fine Jewelry Collections, Silversmithing, Goldsmithing and Metalsmithing. 

Every 3rd Sunday a process demonstration will be conducted in the studio at 2:30pm, this will take place during the Hoboken Gallery Walk.  We can exchange information about various techniques used to make jewelry, silversmithing or goldsmithing.  You are welcome to request a technique or do a demonstration of your own. (please set up in advance)

Meetups will be held in my studio at the Monroe Arts Center, art jewelry galleries, museums and other studios or venues that share interest in art jewelry.  

I would like to share information about the art jewelry community, up and coming events, conferences, openings and competitions happening around our community and outside. I would like to create a dialog about topics that include tools, techniques, processes, materials and why we make what we make.  I think we could learn a lot from each other. 

EatMetal, Inc studio includes a gallery space, workbenches for students, a communal workspace and my own personal work space. I will host open houses, events to preview my new fine jewelry collections, one of a kind pieces and small scale sculpture. Guest jewelry artist's will be invited to come and show their work in the gallery.  All level classes are offered in the fall, winter and spring for an 8 week session. The focus is on core fundamentals and honing your skills. Great fun at the studio is Evening or Afternoon One Day Workshops @ EatMetal, Inc. which center on one project and you get to Bring Your Bling Home!  


Look forward to seeing you in the studio!
results.name: EatMetal, Inc.  Art Jewelry Studio

Three times a month a surrealist film will be screened in an apartment directly off the 2/3 train. From 515-615; a short or series of shorts will be shown informally as we eat and talk. All feature films will begin promptly at 633pm and guests are asked to stay no later than 1111pm. Snacks will be provided relating to the film, but additional beverages and foods are welcome.

Most films will be followed by an optional discussion and group poetic act. Attendees are encouraged - but not required to - write, paint, draw, sing, slam, rap, rhyme, mime or daydream a response to the movie shown. After the discussion the group will brainstorm a positive poetic act that assists a single member in overcoming an obstacle or problem. Looking to appoint a co-organizer to help with planning and hosting before start of the new year. Applicants message me a recent dream and a haiku.

I started this group because I realized that there is both a deficit in knowledge in the consumer application development community about "connected cars" and a huge market for developers that do. Need equals opportunity. NYC is not a car town and you may very likely not drive one (or even own one). I had reached out to nearly 20 of my favorite tech minds and none of them had worked on a connected car project, either an IVI or OBD2 app, and all wanted to. This tells me that there is definitely a need for us all to get together. My intention is to create a regular opportunity to collaborate on ideas

results.description:
This group is for any 29+ age careerwomen looking to network and socialize with each other for friendship or casual business networking. We do different ice breaker events, networking and social events at new restaurants, tea houses, wineries, board game nights etc. 

The mission of this group is to enable careerwomen with current, active, ongoing careers to network and socialize with each other in order to educate, emotionally support career women in their careers and in their career-focused lifestyles. It is create a outlet for women to discuss different topics that affect careerwomen every day including individual-specific topics like navigating in your career, overcoming challenges at work, e.g., making alliances with key people in the office-- as well as external factors like the global, national, local business/economy,  the glass ceiling, when will be the first female president.  Whether you are in an ambitious mode or cruising in your job, this is the outlet for you to have a voice about these topics. But do not be fooled - much bantering and jokes are welcome -- we are here to get to know each other.  While networking is encouraged, sales /self marketing is prohibited.

If you are trying to reconnect with new female contacts who are ambitious, intelligent and educated like you, please join us and let's talk shop from female point of view! 

These conversation topics are encouraged: travel, movies, music as well as the intellectual topics like economics, business, finance, even politics and perhaps technology that is ever changing and affecting business.

Whether training for your first 5k, putting the finishing touches on your fall-marathon training, or looking for a fun and friendly introduction to running, Sneaker Factory Group Runs are the perfect fit. Each Monday and Wednesay at 6:45PM, year round, we meet for 3-5 casual miles through the flat and tree lined neighborhoods of Florham Park. The runs are FREE and led by store owner, Joe Jacobs, and pace/distance is always decided by the group. 

Our goal is to provide a friendly and judgement free environment for rookie and seasoned veteran runners, alike! From time to time we will have shoe brand "wear test runs", guest speakers (experienced marathoners, coaches, professional runners), and will always have water/recovery drink available after every run! Bring any running-related questions... we are happy to help!

All events take place at Sneaker Factory Florham Park - 177 Columbia Tpk, Florham Park, NJ 07932.

Join our group for a run one Monday, it's more fun running with friends! For more info visit out website - www.sneakerfactoryfp.com, or facebook - https://www.facebook.com/SFFlorhamPark?ref=hl

Founded by local divers and instructors in 1995, the Explorers Dive Club is a nonprofit group promoting dive community, sharing knowledge and experience. We are a group of central New Jersey recreational divers representing all ages, certifications, diving interests and levels of experience.

Our monthly meetings feature prominent speakers in the sport of diving or the arts of photography and videography. Club meetings are held on the 2nd Tuesday of the month at 7:30 pm at the Spain Inn in Piscataway from April through October. Meetings are held in one of the restaurant's private dining rooms - just ask the wait staff where the scuba divers are meeting. Join us for dinner before the meeting at 6:30 pm. Visitors are welcome!

We organize boat dives, dive vacations and other social events, including a December holiday dinner, a Sunday brunch, a summer picnic and a Delaware River rafting trip.

Need a dive buddy? Join the club!

• Prominent Guest Speakers

• Discount Jersey Boat Dives

• Exotic Vacations with Group Discounts

• Fun Social Events

• 50/50 Raffle at Monthly Meeting

Visit us on the Web www.explorersdiveclub.org

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses
Group for younger widows/widowers to have support
Social Meeting for Widows and Widowers

results.description:
Soaring Spirits is an organization  run by widowed people, that connects widowed people world wide. Our goal is to give you hope and to let you know that you're not alone. We have Regional Groups all over the US and are starting one here in NYC. It's a social group where we all connect and share. Although our group is open to anyone in the NY/NJ area or anyone who wants to travel for a social event, most of our meet-ups are in Manhattan. Sometimes we meet in other buroughs as well. This is a social hang-out group, not a support group, although we do offer each other plenty of support.  

 We're all inclusive - no matter your age, sex, religion (or lack thereof), sexual preference, relationship status, etc. This is NOT a dating service, it's a place to connect and make friends. We meet 2x per month at local restaurants, parks, beaches, movies, plays, museums, and many other fun events. If you have lost the person you planned on spending the rest of your life with to death, and you'd like to meet other people who "get it", give us a try. Welcome.
results.name: NYC-Area Widows and Widowers Soaring Spirits Group Meetup

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
The Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club has been providing lively discussions of books focused on foreign affairs, international issues, and US economic and political themes for the last 7+ years. Our core group of 12-15 welcomes all those interested in joining the discussion.

We meet monthly (Sept-June) often on the 3rd Tuesday at the Greenwich Library.  (Check the front desk for to see which meeting room we're in).

Our current members have a variety of experiences and a wealth of personal history and perspective to share from past careers and/or travel.  We've had people come for one topic, never to see them again, and others who have been stalwart attendees from Day 1.

We try to find books that are not too long (300 page targeted maximum), that might appeal to a broader audience (so we can justify the Library buying a few copies), and that are on topics that our readers are looking to explore.  

I've listed the books we've reviewed over the last few years on a page in the Pages section so that you can get a feel for our style.

Feel free to join us to just observe the discussion, or dive right in.
results.name: Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club

results.description:
Sing with our choir! For us, singing creates a dynamic collaboration between the bold and the shy, the untrained and the trained, the audience and the performers. Creating harmony can actually make the world a more beautiful place, and in so doing, we can become a healing voice for our communities and ourselves. Explore through song the musically rich and diverse cultures that abound in the world, celebrating the very best in all of us. 

Unitarian Universalism (UU), evolved from two liberal Christian denominations over more than 200 years. UU’s don’t ascribe to any one set of religious beliefs, stories or doctrines, but we are interfaith, including Christians, Jews, Buddhists, atheists, agnostics, pagans, humanists, mystics and others. UU’s believe in the inherent worth and dignity of every person, loving community and social justice, and treating our planet well.

We sing the sacred and secular, everything from Mozart to Motown. We welcome all who love to sing!
results.name: UU Congregation of Queens Choir

Walking, light- hiking, monthly group gatherings, (ideas welcome for that...)

Hope to see you soon!

Madeleine

results.description:
We'd like to share experiences building scalable monitoring and alerting solutions using Graphite, Grafana, Collectd, Nagios, Logstash, Elasticsearch and Kibana, among others.

We believe that it is easy to collect metrics from any one system, and to define alerts on single metrics. We already have this capability in place. However, in complex systems, the real operational challenges arise from the way system components interact. Some of these components live inside our data center, some live outside our data center, and all are updating on differing timelines. The functionality and performance of every component has the potential to change every day.

Our challenge is to identify patterns and correlations across multiple systems in our stack. We need to integrate top-down and bottom-up analysis, so we can see, for example, that trial subscription signups (a user metric) fell off at the same time that an internal API call began to fail (an application metric), and it was caused by a database host falling offline (a system metric).

When collecting so much data, there is a risk of being overwhelmed and not being able to make sense of it all. In essence, a risk of collecting data but not producing intelligence. We combat this risk by converting our accumulated data into the most visually information-dense format available: graphs. Then we make graphs easy to compare and easy to share. We make them informative at a glance and easy for the team to keep watching. Finally, once we are regularly identifying patterns across our graphs, we should have an automated way to "watch the graphs" in our absence. It is not an AI or a pattern recognition "black box", it should just automate patterns that humans have first validated to be meaningful.
results.name: Monitoring NYC

We look to bring to light, discussion, and problem solving of challenges and opportunities of Tech Hardware products and cover the high growth areas of:

results.description:
Welcome to SOCCER FOR FUN!  We are a Co-Ed Adult Soccer Club for those who love the game of soccer and are searching for a friendly and exciting atmosphere to enjoy it. Our players' skills range from beginners to more advanced players that enjoy playing more relaxed games than those found in competitive leagues.

Our games will be held primarily at Raymond O'Conner Park 33rd Avenue & Corporal Kennedy St. Bayside NY 11361  or at Alley Pond Sports Center Park located at corner of Union Turnpike and Winchester Blvd, Queens Village (79-20 Winchester Blvd, Queens Village, NY 11427) starting at 9:00 AM sharp! Members should always check the site for any updates on the venue and times. We will host various games from small pug games to big field 11 v. 11 games to exciting tournaments throughout the year.  In addition to our weekly games from time to time we will host other events such as attending professional soccer matches, viewing sporting events at local pubs, annual BBQ and so on.  

Code of Conduct

·  Never be disrespectful to other players or opponents

·  Foul language will be frowned upon and unacceptable

·  Obey the RSVP rules

Rules of Play

·  Slide tackling, high kicks or rough play strictly prohibited

·  Penalties in the box if intentional are taken otherwise kicks are always indirect (except during a tournament)

·  Not all games will have referees so please respect any call made by any player on the field.  All disputes will be settled by your Team Captain.

RSVP Rules

If you sign up and make a team for the game you are expected at the field ready, willing and able to play.  All Members can update their RSVP before teams are posted the night before the game.  If you fail to update timely or to show up at a game you will not be permitted to sign up for the next two weeks.  If you fail to show twice you will not be able to sign up for two months.  This rule is enforced in order to get the players on the field that want to play especially if there is a waiting list.  Any and all emergencies will be taken under consideration and any last minute drops if you notify your organizers we will try to get a replacement player for the game thereby preventing a no show.  Our goal is to have full games each week and getting as many members on the field as possible.

Our Club’s mission is to provide a warm, friendly and safe environment for players to come and enjoy Soccer.
results.name: SOCCER FOR FUN

results.description:
This group is for local history buffs - those who want to learn more about our City - either on foot or through slide show/lecture. There are many organizations that offer walks and talks led by docents and experts - some free, some for nominal cost ($20 or under).  

Posted events are open to the public and run by public organizations and licensed tour guides.  Some require pre-registration.  Read the description of the event carefully.  An RSVP on meetup does not mean you have registered for the event.  You will sometimes need to registered beforehand on an organization website or pay in advance to guarantee a spot.

This meetup differs from other walking meetups in that we will only be attending curated events rather than wandering around exploring or being led by the Meetup organizer.  We will be attending tours and lectures offered by tour guides, historical societies, preservation groups among others.   Some events will be in a bar or cafe or other informal place, but some will be more formal classroom style.  We will be meeting up either AT the event or AFTER the event but NOT BEFORE the event.   

Some events have an organizer - the organizer will attend the event and bring a Meetup sign and look for other group members.  Members can group together during the event (i.e., sit together at a lecture) or socialize afterwards.  The organizer cannot always guarantee that you will have a spot at the event unless you pre-register or pay the sponsor of the event.

Some events will not have an organizer.  Those events are posted to inform members of things that are happening in case anyone would like to attend on their own or with friends.  Anyone can become a co-organizer by messaging the organizer, so if there is an event you would like to share, or you would like others to attend with you, please step up.

All posted events are run by organizations or licensed tour guides.  If there is any payment for the event it is made directly to the organization or the tour guide giving the tour.

Have fun and enjoy the events!

Linda Fisher
results.name: NYC Walks and Talks

This group is for anyone interested in 3D printing or seeing awesome things being created. 

Although the landscape is changing there's still not enough resources for first time makers. Whether you've made prints before or simply think the concept sounds awesome, we invite you to join our live and online 3d printing classes. All skill levels are welcome. 

For our in-person classes in NY and BK, we want everyone to have the chance to get hands-on experience using a 3D printer and one-on-one training to go from having a great idea to producing a physical object.  

We offer live webinars as well so those who cannot make our in-person classes can still learn. 

In our classes we teach how a 3D printer works, answer questions and guide folks through the process of creating their first print. No supplies, experience or expertise needed. 

For those looking for more advanced insight into 3D printing we will have folks available for any specific questions. 

You should join our group if you are interested in learning about 3d printing, meeting other 3D printing users, if you own a 3d printer and want exclusive access our awesome software, or like testing out software and hardware in one of the fastest growing industries.   

If you have any projects, ideas or tricks for 3D Printing you'd like to discuss please share them with the group as well! 

Happy printing!

Aaron and Charles

results.description:
True Business Bliss is not about $$ profit, it's all about empowering your greatest asset, YOU!!!

Solopreneurs don't have to go it alone!  Join us for valuable support!

Join us and thrive!!  This is not your average (old-style) networking event! 

I created this group because, for me, traditional networking is a real turnoff.  I'd get up early or stay late and leave these events with  little value received - for anyone but the organizer.  I'd hate the food and take home a bunch of cards meaning little if I didn't remember who gave them to me.

Here, in the Business Bliss Studio, we're dedicated to authentic connection and growing you so you can grow your business.  We're blending business, fun and retreat so you can master true "Business Bliss."  Master the (5) Keys to success (see below). 

Startup entrepreneurs, solopreneurs and conscious business entrepreneurs will really appreciate the support and wisdom we share.

Join us:

• For festive, joyful, authentic social connection & networking!

• Feed your creative soul!

• Experience mindfulness and focused support! 

THE GATHERINGS:

• Breakfast Bliss: These are our morning meetings.  Healthy minds, health food, and lots of individual support. I keep the morning meetings small so you can receive the support you need from the group, and I can share my whole heart and expertise.  We open with mindfulness practice, give you 10 minutes to receive support on the topic of your choice, and close with a mindfulness practice.  Focus, fun, creative support!

• Social Bliss: These are our afternoon or evening social gatherings all about passion and fun!!  Music, food, culture, drinks (alcoholic or non) and authentic, natural networking.  In 2016, we'll expand our circle and partner with other groups and Meetups.

True, sustainable success comes with profit and peace.  No matter what you know in your mind, true success comes from the deepest part of you and your soul.  Your inner entrepreneur is the source of your energy, creativity, confidence, connection.  

Know you, know & define your greater success!  Nurture your connections and grow rich!!!  

Solopreneurs desire freedom and feedback!  Entrepreneurs know it can get lonely, working from home, wearing all of the hats, making all the decisions, 

Think Creative Mastermind + Natural Networking +  Life Support (aka self-care). We're mixing business and retreat to help you access the the 5 keys to success: 

• Clarity. 

• Confidence.

• Creativity. 

• Community. 

• Mindset.  

I'll find the spaces and bring the expertise.  You come to learn, share feedback in our circle, and receive support from me and the other awesome Business Bliss Masters.  

Bring your ideas, let us help you brainstorm.  Bring your biz questions, and let me, and our members help you get answers.  We'll end each session with a mindfulness practice, e.g., meditation, visualization.  This is about heart-centered networking and support.  Creative co-creation rocks!

Networking happens naturally, as you engage in a community of like-hearted entrepreneurs, that speak your language, and have your best interest at heart. 

I believe that growing and sustaining your business shouldn't have to mean burnout.  It's time to slow down to speed up your success so you can know less stress, more creativity, productivity and joy in your life and business.   

Join us if you are a mindful entrepreneur that likes to give and receive support from other awesome entrepreneurs, appreciates mindfulness & meditation, and would love getting out of the office on inspirational outings.

P.S. I invite you to join us and complement this with other groups that are 100% dedicated to networking.  Grow you with us to radiate confidence and power and rock the house as you network in other groups.
results.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
This is a group about how to live more consciously.

We work with issues you want to talk about (e.g., my relationship is on the skids; I'm miserable in my career; I have anxiety; anything at all) and then see what they look like through the lens of any or all of these ancient, universally spiritual concepts:

Be Compassionate • Beliefs Matter • Be Present • Choices Abound • Everything Is Energy • Have an Attitude of Gratitude • Intentions Matter • Judgments Separate Us • Listen to Inspiration • Mind and Body Are Connected • Take Responsibility • The Law of Attraction Is Always On • We Are All Connected • We Are Here for a Reason • We Belong to the Planet, Not the Planet to Us

So if you generally nod your head in agreement with these concepts and are interested in seeing what happens to your Life when you integrate them more and more into your daily experience, grab an issue, grab a friend, and accept my invitation to come to a drop-in class and learn how to live a bit more consciously.

I come and go from my native New York and am thrilled to share this down-to-earth, dynamic, compelling and thought-provoking practice with you while I'm here. I look forward to meeting you and working out some stuff. :)

P.S.  I have taught Spiritual Workout for Entrepreneurs in San Francisco for much of 2014 and here are what some of those folks have said about this class (and it's the same for entrepreneurs and everyone else):

results.description:
Weekly Special Sunday Feast: This is a FREE event without any hidden charge. All are welcome to attend. We host a variety of events to provide spiritual knowledge and satisfaction for the soul. RSVP is not required to attend any of our events - please simply come and join us!

Every Sunday, a simple hall becomes a temple. The love and devotion of the devotees, and the decorated presence of Krishna, positively transform the place. Once the activities begin you are transported to a different world. 

Special Sunday Activities (FREE) - 5:30pm - 9:00pm

•  Sunday School - Cultural training for Children - Gopal class (Ages 5-9) & Madhav class (Ages 10-17)

•  Prasadam (Sanctified Food) - Pure Vegetarian Feast which is offered to the Lord

• Arati (worship), Kirtan (devotional song), Bhajans (hymns), Satsang (devotees association) •  Krishna Katha - Bhagavad Gita, Srimad Bhagvatam discources by illustrious speakers

Picture Gallery from Past Events & Retreats

Video Gallery from Past Events & Retreats

There is an enchanting and purifying arati (worship) and kirtana (devotional song). Everyone participates, singing and dancing hand in hand. The Krishna-Katha (speaking of the Lord) and discussion is absorbing as it is instructive. The Krishna Kids Vedic Sunday School is so popular that many parents ‘have to’ come for the kids’ sake!

Participants of all ages join together in groups singing for the Lord and playing classical instruments while joyfully dancing to the music. Yet the atmosphere is prayerful and respectful. A delicious pure vegetarian feast of Prasadam (sanctified food) is served to one and all – always plenty, always wonderful.

The Center offers a respite from a taxing week at home or work; for many it’s also a fun day for their kids. Join us and see what the Center can offer you! Please join us with your friends and family for our weekly program, and afterwards enjoy a scrumptious pure vegetarian feast.
