Purpose:

Are you looking to expand your social circle through New Jersey & New York adventures? Do you like to go for happy hour specials, brunches, and parties? Perhaps experience trips to museums, shows, malls, shops, beaches and more? Or are you new to NJ/NY and need to make new friends? If so, then this is the right stop for you! This group is re-done to bring together groups of old and new contacts into festive events to establish genuine friendships and great memories. Whether it's to mingle, network, catch up, or chat, it is the aim to have meetup members and their guests feel comfortable and excited at a sociable atmosphere.

Target Audience:

Mostly women but screened males are encouraged to join (sometimes few male friends can be invited to events, not all through membership but those are either group assistant organizers or promoters, trusted friends or guests of members). As the group was originally designed to welcome ladies only, I am strict but flexible to those who wish to bring a male guest that could contribute to the group. The group offers a variety of invites from relaxing happy hours or brunches to dance parties or enjoyable trips so those who want to connect or make new friends can benefit.

results.description:
WELCOME
Hope Hill is a fresh and exciting church that meets at in the heart of Manhattan's Financial District (48 Wall St., 5th floor).  Our service time is Sundays at 3:00pm.  We also have many mid-week Bible studies and community events.  If you are looking to deepen your faith or wrestle with questions on spirituality, this is your place.  Join in the refreshments, live music, intelligent Bible study, and discussion — and connect with amazing New Yorkers just like you.

SUNDAY SERVICE
3:00pm48 Wall Street (5th Floor)Manhattan

HOW TO GET HERE
Take any of these convenient lines: 2/3, J/Z & 4/5.  A few blocks further you'll find the 1, R, A/C, and PATH at World Trade Center. The Staten Island Ferry Whitehall Terminal is only a 5-minute walk away.
 
WHAT TO EXPECT

Our Sunday services gather an amazing crowd for music, food, networking, a thought-provoking lecture, and life-changing discussion.  Our other midweek and weekend events are fun and diverse, and they include: skydiving trips, house parties, hiking trips, relationship workshops, Bible studies, racial unity and reconciliation seminars, community banquets for homeless families, international missions and aid trips, and much more.
results.name: Hope Hill

results.description:
This group is for anyone who wants to control their brain at the highest levels. Brain Body Mastery has two main components. One is mindfulness and other types of meditation, or low stimulus attention control, meaning focusing in a slow and quiet way. The other component is high stimulus attention control, which is about taking simple movements and brain exercises, and integrating them into complex, whole brain activities. They are usually done at faster speed and can demand a fair amount of physical and mental effort.

The following videos explain what this group is about better than any of what's written here, but scroll down if you'd like to read more of what's behind all this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9a8Mz5lWzjg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_uPWHXFEwy4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aNsNIqRVeDc&index=20&list=UUQThuzMvIkqC8wcVjTMjQFg 

Sign up for the FREE self-paced online course here: www.effortwise.info

The beauty of BrBd is that anyone can create new exercises. All it takes is curiosity and a little effort. Find two or more simple, separate activities and integrate them into one, and you grow your brain. Practice mindfulness or meditation, and you grow your brain. Even just practice being curious once in a while, and usually your brain grows.

The goal of BrBd is to be as in control of our conscious energy as possible. The implications reach far beyond just performing better at work or school. The more control you have over how your mind functions, the more quickly you can learn new skills, the more creative you can be, the more relaxed and present you can be, meaning you make better decisions. Aside from the longer term benefits, practicing just makes ya feel good.

For more on the subject of skill learning, here is a page from my website on how to master anything.
results.name: Brain Body Mastery

results.description: Footgolf? Are you sure you don't mean Golf? So... you kick a soccer ball on a golf course? How big are the holes? Footgolf has arrived in New Jersey! Whether you're kicking a ball for the first time since recreation soccer or you're still out there as a weekend warrior playing pick-up, FootGolf is a game for all skill levels. There are five courses in New Jersey: Brigantine, The Links at Brigantine Beach Cream Ridge, Gambler Ridge Golf Course Hamburg, Crystal Springs Golf High Bridge, High Bridge Hills Golf Club Wall Township, Bel-Aire Golf Course I'd like to play at least one time before the end of the year as it starts to get colder and darker earlier.
